name: South to North Vietnam - 10 Days
summary:
Minimum 2 people per booking.
Booking at least 30 days in advance.


Discover all the incredible sights of Vietnam on a comprehensive ten-day tour from South to North of Vietnam! Discover Ho Chi Minh City, Da Nang City, Hoi An Old City, Ha Noi and Ha Long Bay overnight, explore the Cu Chi tunnels, My Son Sanctuary, Hoi An Walking Town, Ha Long Bay and more.
highlights: Connect with locals and cruise to Cai Be Floating Market
Visit the My Son Sanctuary and the Temple of Literature
Explore the remarkable Vietnamese countryside on bike
Swim in the emerald waters of the stunning Ha Long Bay

timeline.title: Day 1: Ho Chi Minh City - Arrival
timeline.description: In and around Da Nang, Ho Chi Minh CityPick-up and welcome at the airport with the transfer to your hotel. Overnight in Ho Chi Minh City.

timeline.title: Day 2: Mekong Delta – Cai Be floating market (BL) by minivan – 2 hours
timeline.description: In and around Cai BeThe day will begin with a two-hour ride from Ho Chi Minh City to the Mekong Delta. You will: take a boat cruise to one of the highlights of the Mekong-Cai Be Floating Market; stop over at a local house to watch how locals make coconut candy, rice-paper, rice-popcorn and rice wine; spend time amidst local farmers, enjoying traditional music and tropical fruits on Tan Phong Islet, lunch on a local specialty- " Elephant Ear Fish “ at a local home. Overnight in Ho Chi Minh City.

timeline.title: Day 3: Cu Chi Tunnels - Da Nang (BL) by flight – 1 hour
timeline.description: In and around Cu Chi TunnelsExplore the famous Cu Chi tunnel complex for fascinating and informative insight into how Vietcong lived in this underground military base. After lunch at a local Vietnamese restaurant, transfer to airport for a flight to Da Nang. Upon arrival, pick up and transfer to the hotel. Overnight in Da Nang.

timeline.title: Day 4: Da Nang (B)
timeline.description: 2019: Day 4 Da Nang - My Son Sanctuary (B) After breakfast, a visit to the My Son Sanctuary is an experience that should not be missed while visiting the beautiful city of Hoi An: wander around the lost Champa Kingdom that dates back to the 3rd century, explore the temples and learn about the fascinating history behind this sanctuary of Hinduism. Free time in the afternoon. Overnight in Da Nang. 2020: Day 4 Da Nang - Free day (B) Free as your leisure day (optional tour are available). Overnight in Da Nang.

timeline.title: Day 5: Da Nang - Hoi An (B)
timeline.description: In and around Hoi An2019: Day 5: Da Nang - Hoi An - Ann Tailor for a free tailor-made item of clothing - Hoi An City Tour (B) Check out. Transfer to Hoi An and contact Ann Tailor to have a free tailor-made item of clothing. In the afternoon, exploring Hoi An ancient town on foot is one of the best ways to absorb the beauty of this city. Overnight in Hoi An. 2020: Day 5: Da Nang - Hoi An City Tour - Ann Tailor for a free tailor-made item of clothing - My Son Sanctuary (B) Check out. Transfer to Hoi An and explore Hoi An ancient town on foot is one of the best ways to absorb the beauty of this city. Contact Ann Tailor to have a free tailor-made item of clothing after the tour. In the afternoon, visit My Son Sanctuary - an experience that should not be missed while visiting the beautiful city of Hoi An: wander around the lost Champa Kingdom that dates back to the 3rd century, explore the temples and learn about the fascinating history behind this sanctuary of Hinduism. Overnight in Hoi An.

timeline.title: Day 6 Hoi An – Foodie tour (BL)
timeline.description: Discover Hoi An’s countryside and its local food by bicycle. We will past verdant rice-paddies to visit a very local village. Sample the traditional Hoi An specialty, Cao Lau. Learn how to make the local delicacy- White Rose. Move on to Cam Nam to sample some Ying and Yang food balancing favorites. Overnight in Hoi An.

timeline.title: Day 7: Hoi An – Da Nang – Ha Noi City Tour (BL) by flight – 1 hour
timeline.description: Have breakfast. Check out. Transfer to Da Nang for flight to Ha Noi. Once arrived in Ha Noi, you visit the Temple of Literature (The first Imperial School in Vietnam), Hoan Kiem Lake, the Jade Mountain Temple, But Tower (Pen-Shaped Tower), Dai Nghien (Ink Stand), The Red – painted wooden and the Huc Bridge…Have a cyclo (pedicab) ride around Ha Noi ancient town. Overnight in Ha Noi.

timeline.title: Day 8: Ha Noi - Ha Long Bay (BLD) – by shuttle bus
timeline.description: The shuttle bus will pick you up at your hotel and depart for Ha Long Bay. Cruise past exquisite scenery; limestone islands majestically rising out of emerald water, seductively scattered with grottoes and caves. Overnight on the Junk Cruise.

timeline.title: Day 9: Ha Long Bay - Ha Noi (BL) – by shuttle bus
timeline.description: After breakfast, swimming and sunbathing. After lunch, return to Ha Noi. Overnight in Ha Noi.

timeline.title: Day 10: Departure (B)
timeline.description: Breakfast and free time until time to go to the airport for departure flight. Transfer to Noi Bai International Airport.

name: Vietnam Express Southbound
summary: Discover the essence of captivating Vietnam on this ten-day tour through backstreets, villages, cities and waterways. Trace the east coast on this fast-paced adventure and take in World Heritage-listed landscapes and towns, feel the buzz of bustling cities and fuel yourself with banh mi and condensed milk coffee. As lively as it is lovely, Vietnam can seem an intimidating place to travel, but our local leaders will guide you to the best street food (and tell you how to order it), introduce you to fishermen on the Mekong Delta and give you the inside scoop on the best tailors in Hoi An. This is an adventure full of life, colour and flavour that introduces you to the highlights of this fascinating nation.
highlights: Enjoy a private cruise in Halong Bay
Explore bustling Ho Chi Minh City
Discover the Forbidden Purple City
Sightsee in Hue on a motorbike

timeline.title: Day 1: Hanoi
timeline.description:
In and around HanoiXin chao! Welcome to Hanoi! Your adventure begins with a welcome meeting at 6 pm and is followed by a group dinner at KOTO restaurant. This organisation is dedicated to developing the hospitality careers of disadvantaged youth.
If you arrive before your tour begins there’s plenty to see and do. Consider booking the Hanoi Morning Highlights Urban Adventure, a wide-ranging tour with a local expert guide. This optional tour visits the Temple of Literature, stops by a traditional tea house, and takes you through the Hoa Lo Prison Memorial before concluding at Hoan Kiem Lake. Or maybe take it at your own pace and wander the Old Quarter to admire the city’s French-colonial architecture. Accommodation: Hotel

timeline.title: Day 2: Halong Bay
timeline.description: Travel by private minibus to World Heritage-listed Halong Bay, which is dotted with sandy coves, grottoes and 1600 limestone islands formed over millennia by wind and water erosion (approximately 4 hours). Board a private boat and cruise the bay, exploring Surprise Cave and perhaps even enjoying a swim from Ti Top Island Beach during the warmer months. Access to Surprise Cave is via staircases. Once inside the cave the pathways are a little uneven and slippery. To end the day, spend an evening aboard the boat beneath the night sky. What better way to get to know your fellow travellers than an old school sleepover in an unforgettable location? Accommodation: Overnight boat

timeline.title: Day 3: Hanoi – Overnight train
timeline.description: Return by boat to Halong Bay. At approximately midday, return to Hanoi by bus. Arrive late this afternoon and enjoy free time until tonight’s train voyage. Be sure to grab a bowl of pho while you’re in town and slurp down this local specialty made from broth, noodles and meat. Maybe chill by Hoan Kiem Lake until you board an overnight train to Hue this evening. Accommodation: Overnight sleeper train

timeline.title: Day 4: Hue
timeline.description: In and around HueArrive in Hue at approximately 11 am and transfer to the hotel. Once the imperial capital of Vietnam, Hue holds the treasures of the country’s royal past. Enjoy free time in the morning to rest or explore. If you choose the latter (and who can blame you) the bustling Dong Ba Market is a great place to sample some of the specialties that once graced the Nguyen emperors' tables like banh khoai (royal rice cake). Reunite with the group to visit the war-damaged ruins of the Imperial Citadel, a sprawling city-within-a-city which contains the remains of temples, state houses and the emperor’s palace. Accommodation: Hotel

timeline.title: Day 5: Hue
timeline.description: See Hue like a local – from the back of a motorbike! Straddle the saddle and whiz around town with a local guide, taking in historic and contemporary sights along the way. Stop at Thanh Toan to see the 18th-century covered bridge and villagers shopping at their local market. Visit the 17th-century active Buddhist monastery of Thien Mu Pagoda and see the car that belonged to Thích Quang Duc, the monk who self-immolated in 1963 in protest against the treatment of Buddhists by the South Vietnamese regime. For lunch, savour a vegetarian feast in a nunnery. Finish at the lakeside royal tomb of Emperor Tu Duc before heading back to town. Accommodation: Hotel

timeline.title: Day 6: Hoi An
timeline.description: In and around Hoi An, Ho Chi Minh CityThis morning travel by bus through coastal rice paddies and the spectacular Hai Van Pass (approximately 3 hours). After a photo stop en route, arrive into Hoi An. Recently declared a World Heritage site, Hoi An was a major international trading port during the 17th, 18th and 19th centuries. Today, parts of the beautifully-preserved town retain the feel of centuries past. It's also a shopping mecca, famous for its plethora of tailors. On arrival your leader will take you on a sightseeing walk through the Old Town to visit a handful of the city's major attractions. You’ll also be given a sightseeing pass so you can further explore select attractions at your leisure. Accommodation: Hotel

timeline.title: Day 7: Hoi An
timeline.description: Today is a free day to explore Hoi An. Maybe browse the cobbled streets and art galleries or hire a bike and cycle through rice paddies out to Cua Dai Beach. Maybe browse for paintings, ceramics and colourful cloth lanterns in the town’s markets and preserved Chinese shophouses. If you’re craving a new look, you could pay a visit to one of the hundreds of tailors and get something special made. Hoi An is also known for its delicious regional food, so be sure to enjoy a meal at a riverside restaurant or perhaps partake in a cooking class. Accommodation: Hotel

timeline.title: Day 8: Ho Chi Minh City
timeline.description: Today take a short, early morning flight to Ho Chi Minh City (approximately 1.5 hours). Formerly known as Saigon, Ho Chi Minh City has a fascinating history and is arguably Vietnam’s capital of commerce and culture. After landing, take a sightseeing tour around the city by bus. Pass the Reunification Palace, Notre Dame Cathedral and the Opera House, then stop in at the War Remnants Museum to discover some of the sobering stories of the 20-year-long Vietnam/American War. Accommodation: Hotel

timeline.title: Day 9: Mekong Delta – Ho Chi Minh City
timeline.description: This morning head out on a day trip to explore the Mekong Delta. Board a private boat to Ben Tre to visit the coconut gardens and stop at a local home to sample tropical fruits and coconut jams. Afterwards, paddle in sampans (small rowing boats) past coconut trees along the Mekong Delta. Take a tuk-tuk tour around the villages and learn about rural life and the industry created around coconut products like brooms and coconut fibre mats. Eat lunch at a restaurant in the heart of the Delta, sampling regional specialties such as the famous elephant ear fish. Cruise the major waterways to Ben Tre boat pier, then return by bus to Ho Chi Minh City. This evening, perhaps head out to sample some local specialties as a final farewell with your fellow travellers and leader. Accommodation: Hotel

timeline.title: Day 10: Ho Chi Minh City
timeline.description: There are no activities included and you’re free to depart your accommodation at any time as long as you comply with check out time. If you would like to spend some more time in Ho Chi Minh City, we’re happy to organise additional accommodation (subject to availability). Ask your group leader or booking agent for more recommendations or help booking an Urban Adventure if you plan to stay.

name: Vietnam Intro - 9 Day
summary:
Vietnam Intro is the most amazing way to experience Vietnam! You’ll discover crazy Hanoi, experience the stunning Ha Long Bay, stay on your own private island, go sea kayaking, crab fishing with traditional fisherman, soak up fascinating local culture, learn to cook delicious Vietnamese food, relax on beautiful beaches, party the night away and much more. And you’ll have an awesome Group Leader with you from the moment you step off the plane, an instant group of friends to share your adventure with and help with all your onward travel. Get ready for the trip of a lifetime!
+ We'll plant 10 trees for every INTRO Travel tour booking!
highlights: Save Now, Travel Later with Unlimited Date Changes
An amazing itinerary with all activities included
Explore Hanoi by Rickshaw
Sail the magical Ha Long Bay
Stay overnight on your own private Island
Learn to cook delicious Vietnamese food
Bicycle and Riverboat tour of Ninh Binh
Experience local life

timeline.title: Day 1: Vietnam Intro Begins!
timeline.description: Landing in Hanoi, we’ll meet you at the airport and take you to your boutique hostel in the heart of the old town. Meet up with your travel crew and get excited for the adventures to come.

timeline.title: Day 2: Discover Hanoi
timeline.description: In and around HanoiWe’ll jump straight into the hustle and bustle of Hanoi today with a walking and rickshaw tour of the city. Soak in daily life in the chaotic capital and fill up on spicy spring rolls and tasty street food. This evening we’ll be heading out for dinner and drinks to see what Hanoi has to offer after dark.

timeline.title: Day 3: Ha Long Bay Overnight Boat
timeline.description: From Hanoi we’ll travel to Ha Long Bay, where we’ll cruise the emerald green waters surrounded by limestone mountains, feeling like we’re not quite on this planet. The secret caves and coves will prove too much to resist, so we’ll jump into kayaks to explore further before settling down for the evening on our overnight boat complete with hot tub and bar.

timeline.title: Day 4: Ha Long Bay Private Island Stay
timeline.description: Waking up to gorgeous Ha Long Bay shimmering in the sunshine, you’ll be glad to know you’ve got one more night in this watery paradise. We’ll continue our boat journey until we arrive at our very own private island, our home for the night.

timeline.title: Day 5: Ha Long Bay & Ninh Binh Homestay
timeline.description: The rice paddies and vast limestone mountains of Ninh Binh await us today, where we’ll be staying at a local homestay in traditional bungalows right by the river.

timeline.title: Day 6: Ninh Binh & Overnight Train
timeline.description: Heading out to explore the countryside retreat of Ninh Binh, we’ll take to two wheels to weave through the rice paddies before taking a local row boat through the network of rivers and caves. We’ll finish our time here with a sunset hike to the Dragon Mountain viewpoint, before boarding our overnight train bound for Hoi An.

timeline.title: Day 7: Arrive in Hoi An
timeline.description: In and around Hoi AnBeautiful, historical Hoi An will win you over in an instant as we arrive this morning. We’ll check in to our hotel, then this afternoon you’ll have time to explore, go shopping, or perhaps visit a local tailor to get a custom suit or dress made.

timeline.title: Day 8: Hoi An, Basket Boat Tour with Crab Fishing & Cooking Class
timeline.description: Local fishermen will be our guides today as we weave through coconut groves, teaching us the art of crab fishing. We’ll then take part in a hands on cooking class to become masters of all things Vietnamese cuisine.

timeline.title: Day 9: Head home or stay on longer in Hoi An
timeline.description: Your unforgettable 9 day adventure will come to an end here. Those flying home will make their way to the airport, or keep living the dream and extend your stay in Vietnam or South East Asia with our help and the new friends you’ve made.

Explore Hanoi by Rickshaw
Sail the magical Ha Long Bay
Stay overnight on your own private Island
Learn to cook delicious Vietnamese food
Experience local life
Mekong Delta & Cu Chi Tunnels

timeline.description: Local fishermen will be our guides today as we weave through coconut groves, teaching us the art of crab fishing. We’ll then take part in a hands on cooking class to become masters of all things Vietnamese cuisine.

timeline.title: Day 9: Fly to Ho Chi Minh City
timeline.description: Taking to the skies, we’ll head south to the bustling city of Ho Chi Minh. The rest of the day will be yours to explore as you wish.

timeline.title: Day 10: Mekong Delta
timeline.description: Today we’ll explore the incredibly lush green beauty of the Mekong Delta. See how locals live and work on the river, visit local villages, and stay tonight in a local homestay.

timeline.title: Day 11: Cu Chi Tunnels
timeline.description: In and around Cu Chi TunnelsThe Cu Chi Tunnels are on the agenda for today. This network of hand dug underground tunnels played a crucial role in the Vietnam War, providing supply routes, hideouts and living quarters for soldiers. Arriving back into Ho Chi Minh City in the afternoon, we’ll be dressing sharp for our farewell dinner and party this evening.

timeline.title: Day 12: Check Out and Onward Travel
timeline.description: Your unforgettable 12 day adventure will come to an end today. Those flying home will make their way to the airport, or keep living the dream and extend your stay in Vietnam or South East Asia with our help and the new friends you’ve made.

name: 7 Days Discovery Central of Vietnam
summary:
Minimum 2 people per booking.
Booking at least 30 days in advance.


The Central part of Vietnam is extremely rich in heritage and history. This trip will give you chance to explore the best sightseeing of the Central of Vietnam, you have a 7-day tour package taking you through Da Nang, Hoi An, Hue, Quang Binh, visit Hoi An Old Town, My Son Sanctuary, Hue Citadel and Paradise Cave.
highlights: Wander around the lost Champa Kingdom.
Bask in the amazing architecture of Hindu temples.
Step back in time and visit Vietnam battle sites.
Take a step in the mystical Paradise Cave.
Venture through tombs of royalty in Hue.

timeline.title: Day 1: Da Nang – Arrival
timeline.description:
In and around Da NangPick-up and welcome at the airport with the transfer to your hotel. Overnight in Da Nang.Start point
 Pick up from Da Nang Airport, Da Nang International Airport, Hai Chau Dist., Da Nang City, Quận Hải Châu, Đà Nẵng 552200, Vietnam

timeline.title: Day 2 Da Nang – Quang Tri – Quang Binh (BLD)
timeline.description: We will depart Da Nang and head for Quang Tri Province. Along the way, we will stop at a number of different battle sites to see the Quang Tri Citadel, Ben Hai River, Hien Luong Bridge, and Seventeenth Parallel - the former borderline between North and South Vietnam during the war. In the afternoon, we will visit the Vinh Moc Tunnels where North Vietnamese guerilla fighters lived and fought. We will continue on our way to Dong Hoi, check in at a hotel and relax for the night. Overnight in Quang Binh.

timeline.title: Day 3 Quang Binh - Paradise Cave – Hue (BLD)
timeline.description: In and around HueThe day will begin with breakfast before driving to Paradis Cave. The cave was discovered by scientist of the British Caving Research Association in 2005, has the length of 31 km, the longest dry cave in Asia. With naturally primitive features Thien Duong cave look like a landscape painting, making it very attractive to visitors. According to spelunkers, the deeper one journey into the cave, the more one feels the wells of heavenly clarity all around. There are a series of white crystal stalactites resembling glass pillars and many other spectacular formations. After crossing an old forest, visitors see the entrance to the cave shaded by century-old trees and then dazzled by the mysterious beauty of stalactite pillars, each dozens of meters in diameter and grandiose rock arches, which are works made by the enchantment and sudden inspiration of the Creator over the past million of year. After visiting these legendary trails we will return to Hue after lunch. Overnight in Hue.

timeline.title: Day 4 Hue heritages – Hoi An (BL)
timeline.description: In and around Hoi AnHue is a place that offers many cultural treasures: the tombs of kings, the imperial citadel and temples. In Vietnam there is no other place that has as many original historical remnants as this ancient capital. On this tour, we will visit the most famous landmarks situated within Hue’s borders, such as: Imperial Citadel, Thien Mu Pagoda or Khai Dinh Tomb, and Dong Ba Riverside Market.  Transfer to Hoi An. Overnight in Hoi An.

timeline.title: Day 5 My Son Sanctuary in the afternoon (B)
timeline.description: My Son Sanctuary is an experience that should not be missed while visiting the beautiful city of Hoi An.  With us as your tour guide, enjoy a half-day trip to visit the capital and religious centre of the former Champa Kingdom, My Son, which has been designated as a UNESCO World Heritage site.  During a time spanning from the 4th to 8th centuries, when Tra Kieu (then known as Simhapura) served as the political capital of Champa, My Son was the site of the most important Cham intellectuals and a religious centre.  It is also believed that this site could have been used as a place of burial for Cham monarchs. My Son is considered to be Cham’s counterpart to the grand cities of South-East Asia’s other Indian influenced civilizations: Angkor (Cambodia), Bagan (Myanmar), Ayuthaya (Thailand), and Borobudur (Java). Overnight in Hoi An.

timeline.title: Day 6 Hoi An – Foodie tour (BL)
timeline.description: Discover Hoi An’s countryside and its local foods by bicycle. We will start our tour with a ride through the countryside to a local village with a stop to enjoy a bowl of Cao Lau. Cao Lau is a traditional Hoi An specialty composed of local noodles, pork, fresh vegetables and rice paper. The noodles are made with local sticky rice soaked in the water that must be taken from Ba Le Well: the oldest well in Hoi An, believed to have the best water anywhere. You will also be able learn to make special white rose cakes with a local family and have the opportunity to enjoy them. Before the end of the tour, we will go to Cam Nam to enjoy the Ying and Yang food such as: Banh Dap, Che Bap. This tour is definitely an interesting journey. Overnight in Hoi An.

timeline.title: Day 7: Hoi An - Da Nang - Departure (B)
timeline.description:
Have breakfast in the hotel and relax. Transfer to the airport in Da Nang for departure flight.End point
 Drop off at Da Nang Airport, Da Nang International Airport, Hai Chau Dist., Da Nang City, Quận Hải Châu, Đà Nẵng 552200, Vietnam

name: Vietnam at a Glance - 7 Days
summary: This tour is a guaranteed departure, so even if you are the only one booked onto this tour, you will still be guaranteed to depart!
highlights: Challenge yourself and crawl through the Cu Chi Tunnels
Explore the striking limestone cliffs and caves in Halong Bay
Be entertained by a performance at a water puppet theatre

timeline.title: Day 1: Arrive in Ho Chi Minh City
timeline.description:
In and around Ho Chi Minh CityOur driver picks up you at Tan Son Nhat airport and transfers you to the hotel for check-in. Stay overnight in Ho Chi Minh city (meals not included for this day).
  Distance: Tan Son Nhat Airport  Saigon centre: 7  8km (~30-minute drive) Liberty Parkview Saigon Hotel 3* or similarStart point
 Airport pick up, Tan Son Nhat International Airport, Trường Sơn, Quận Tân Bình, Hồ Chí Minh 736900, Vietnam

timeline.title: Day 2: Cu Chi - Ho Chi Minh City (B, L)
timeline.description: In and around Cu Chi Tunnels8:30 am This morning enjoy a city tour that includes the Reunification Hall, formerly known as the Presidential Palace. It was towards this modern building that Communist tanks rolled on the morning of April 30, 1975, as Saigon fell. This fascinating building is filled with history still fresh in the minds of many. The tour also includes the Old Post Office, the Notre Dame Cathedral, the Jade Emperor Pagoda or War museum. Next, we visit the Cu Chi Tunnels, the incredible network of tunnels that once stretched for 210 miles. This underground complex was built by guerilla fighters beginning in 1940 and construction continued throughout the Vietnam War. Stay overnight in Ho Chi Minh city.  (Breakfast, Lunch included) Distance: Saigon  Cu Chi Tunnel: 75 km (~ 1.5 hour drive) Liberty Parkview Saigon Hotel 3* or similar

timeline.title: Day 3: Ho Chi Minh City - Hanoi (B)
timeline.description: In and around HanoiAfter breakfast at the hotel, you will have free time until leaving for Hanoi by flight (Pick-up at the hotel at around 3 hours before departure flight time)  Upon arrival in Noi Bai airport, be warmly welcomed and transfer to visit the capital of Vietnam - the city of lakes, of peace and historical sites. The out-side trip from the car covers Hanoi Westlake, Flower Market Quang Ba Truc Bach Lake, Hoan Kiem Lake, and cultural city landmarks as Temple of literature, Ho Chi Minh mausoleum (all outside view, sitting on the car).  Later we walk through the busy traffic to the water puppet theatre and enjoy a performance of the famed traditional art form created by village farmers around the Red River Delta region. (Optional) Stay overnight in Hanoi.  (Breakfast included) Distance: Noi Bai airport - Hanoi city center: 30 km (~ 45 minute drive) Pomihoa Hotel Hanoi 3* or similar

timeline.title: Day 4: Hanoi - Halong Bay (B, L, D)
timeline.description: 08:00 - 08:30 Pick up at your hotel. Enjoy the interesting scenery on the 3.5 hours-way drive to Halong Bay. 12:30 pm: Embark the cruise for check-in and have lunch. Enjoy the buffet lunch onboard while the cruise sails passing by magnificent sceneries of the World Heritage Site. Explore Sung Sot Cave  Hiking up and down 600 steps to the magnificent limestone formations of the biggest and most marvellous cave in Halong Bay. Then, back to the vessel and continue sailing. Enjoy your relaxing time aboard, among the magnificence of the UNESCO World Heritage Site. A wide range of fine wines or spirits is served in the open-air bar on the sundeck. Participate in cooking class under the attentive instruction of our top chef, to discover the Vietnamese cuisine of traditional spring rolls. Time for dinner and evening entertainments: bar, spa, squid fishing and overnight on the cruise. Stay overnight on Halong Bay Cruise (Deluxe Cabin). (Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner included) Distance: Hanoi central  Halong Bay: 180 km (~ 3.5 hour drive) Garden Bay Cruises 3* or similar

timeline.title: Day 5: Halong - Hanoi (B, L)
timeline.description: Wake up early to enjoy the stunning sunrise on the Bay. Begin a new day with a Tai Chi session on the sundeck. Coffee & tea with assorted homemade pastries will be served onboard. Relax or visit Titop Island. You can take part in an array of exciting activities: swimming, kayaking, trekking, etc. Passengers enjoy Vietnamese breakfast while the cruise passing by other beautiful parts of the Bay. Check out & back to the Tourist Wharf. Return back to Hanoi, stop on the way for restroom and go shopping with a variety of local hand-made products. Arrive in Hanoi. Check in hotel and stay in Hanoi. Pomihoa Hotel Hanoi 3* or similar

timeline.title: Day 6: Hanoi - Mai Chau Valley - Ba Khan Village Resort (B, L, D)
timeline.description: 08h30. Depart from Hanoi. Enjoy a scenic drive along one of the most beautiful country road to the peaceful Bakhan Village via Hoa Binh City. 10:30: Take a short break for tea/coffee in the middle way. 12h00. Lunch at Bakhan Village Restaurant. Check-in room. 15h00. Afternoon walk around the Muong Village of Khan Ha and village’s West hill for a breath taking view of the valley. 19h00. Dinner time at Bakhan Restaurant. 20h00 -21h00. Enjoy the unique traditional dance by Villagers Overnight at Bakhan Village Resort Bakhan Village Resort 4*

timeline.title: Day 7: Bakhan Village - Hanoi/Concludes (B, L)
timeline.description:
Day: Bakhan Village - Hanoi (B, L) 09h00. Take another great workout in nature with our East Mountain trek route.  11h00. Back to the resort. Rest and relax  12h00. Check out. Enjoy lunch at the resort 13h30. Depart for Hanoi. 17h00. Arrive Hanoi Old Quarter. Trip ends at your hotel (arranged by your own). Good bye and see you again!End point
 Trip ends in Hanoi Old Quarter, Quận Hoàn Kiếm, Hanoi, Vietnam 17:00 - 17:30

name: Vietnam Experience
summary: Looking for the full experience tour of Vietnam? This trip takes you through Ho Chi Minh, Hoi An, Hanoi & Halong Bay with plenty of action and highlights to immerse yourself into this enchanting culture. Picture yourself relishing the rice region of Mekong Delta by taking a traditional boat through floating markets & local fruit farms, stopping in exciting & iconic hot spots & popular local foodie haunts for a true Vietnam experience.
highlights: Learn about the Vietnam war, Ho Chi Minh
Have dinner with a local Vietnamese Family, Mekong Delta
Taste authentic Vietnamese food on street food tour, Hue

timeline.title: Day 1: Arrive Ho Chi Minh City
timeline.description: In and around Ho Chi Minh CityWelcome to Ho Chi Minh city, formerly known as Saigon. This is one of Asia's most exhilarating cities, steeped in grand history and post-Vietnam war memories. This evening you'll meet your travel comrades and explore the Ben Thanh markets, offering the freshest traditional Bánh mì, Pho and Bia hơi. Oh yes, this is the right way to get the Vietnam party started.

timeline.title: Day 2: Ho Chi Minh City to Mekong Delta
timeline.description: It's goodbye busy city and hello river life today as we make for the Mekong Delta for an extra special overnight experience you won't be forgetting fast.Travelling down the river on local sampans, peace and tranquillity will be at an all time high. This afternoon we'll spend our time getting a serious learning fix by visiting a local tea garden and seeing the floating markets, learning about local industries along the river and the way of life here and meet some of the friendliest people on earth. Definitely one to give us all the local feels, topped off with a night at our Mekong Guesthouse.

timeline.title: Day 3: Mekong Delta to Ho Chi Minh City
timeline.description: After an early breakfast we'll make our way back to Ho Chi Minh, detouring past the staggering 250-kilometres of tunnels that make up the Viet Cong’s Cu Chi.See traps, hidden doors & some of the 250kms of tunnels that Vietnamese resistance fighters dug by hand, and even go down into the skinny tunnels to experience them first hand in this look into Vietnam's staggering past.Back in the addictive mayhem of Vietnam's biggest city you will have free time to carry on your explorations. Continuing to eat your way through Vietnam's culinary highlights would be one wise way to use your time (we think).

timeline.title: Day 4: Ho Chi Minh City to Nha Trang
timeline.description: In and around Nha TrangWith some traditional R'n'R on our afternoon agenda, the morning can be used to put on our discovering boots. We'll dabble in history and religion before taking flight to a coastal town overlooking the South China Sea.Golden sand beaches, turquoise oceans, water sports galore - this is Nha Trang. This afternoon why not book in for a mineral mud bath and hot thermal spring experience before heading out to dinner with your crew. Ah, the good life.

timeline.title: Day 5: Nha Trang
timeline.description: Good news - we're kicking it in Nha Trang for another night. Have a massage, sign up for the optional cruise, or just hang on the beach saving your energy for seaside bar fun as the sun sets.

timeline.title: Day 6: Nha Trang to Hoi An
timeline.description: In and around Hoi AnCatch you later Nha Trang and hello Hoi An.Get your bearings with a guided tour through the Old Quarter, and fall deeply in love with this perfect spot. Japanese Bridge, French Colonial vibes and brightly coloured buildings are endlessly charming. You'll be feeling hungry no doubt, so tonight we'll bet we can tempt you with our optional Vietnamese cooking class to get your cooking skills on form and show off to your friends back home. With our expert chef leading the charge, you'll soon be feeling like a bit of an expert. Armed with new skills, ask your Trip Manager about where to head for a night out with the group.

timeline.title: Day 7: Hoi An
timeline.description: A short drive from Hoi An are the famous Marble Mountains, a collection of 5 peaks that represent the 5 Elements in Vietnamese folk lore – metal, wood, earth, fire and water. Our local guide would be delighted to take us on a tour through the Thuy Son caves and grottos which are home to some of the most beautiful and intricate stone carvings in the area. The Marble Mountains were also the hiding place of the US Forces during the Vietnam Conflict and even a military hospital! Hear about the history while taking in panoramic views and later, kick back at An Bang Beach before heading back to Hoi An for more Free Time Addons.

timeline.title: Day 8: Hoi An to Hue
timeline.description: In and around HueThough we'll have grown content with Hoi An life, this morning the show must go on. After all, the former imperial town of Hue has invited us over, and we'd be foolish to turn it down.Intricately decorated pavilions, lotus flower ponds, and colourful artworks mark our first sightseeing venture in Hue. Totally in awe of Tu Duc Mausoleum, we move on to the 7-story Thien Mu Pagoda & learn of the horrific history of the Hue Buddhist massacre as well as taking in a cyclo ride to see the city from a whole new angle.

timeline.title: Day 9: Hue to Hanoi
timeline.description: In and around HanoiToday we fly out of Hue in the direction of Vietnam's time capsule capital. A trio of influences and filled with romance, 2-nights here will see us utterly smitten.With an epic fusion of French, Chinese & Vietnamese influence, you'll be nothing short of ecstatic as we check-in to our Hanoi hotel, right in the middle of the bustling Old Quarter. Our time will be spent weaving through a maze of 36 trading streets filled with colourful goods for sale, and unwinding in the walled gardens of the Temple of Literature. Later, we'll roam French-style boulevards and maybe dine on a nom ngo sen lotus-stem salad, dau chien ron fried tofu & a few bia hoi beers.

timeline.title: Day 10: Hanoi to Halong Bay
timeline.description: After a Hanoi history 101 lesson we move on to Halong Bay where a night on a UNESCO World Heritage-listed site awaits.A drive through stunning scenery will evoke plenty of 'oh wow's, but it only gets better as we board our home for the night, a Chinese-style junk boat in Halong Bay. Feel the serenity kicking in immediately as we drift the limestone island seas of the Gulf of Tonkin. We will pass hidden lagoons, thick forests & dreamy grottos, & stop to explore the Sung Sot Caves. A fresh seafood dinner and sunset at our docking spot will polish off a wonderful daypacked with No Regrets moments and simply unforgettable experiences.

timeline.title: Day 11: Halong Bay to Hanoi
timeline.description: Today will be all about the leisurely vibes as we wake up to breakfast and a grotto swim. Make the most of your time on the junk boat & kayak your way around Halong Bay - the views don't get much better than this.After heading back to Hanoi we find ourselves enjoying our final night together on tour. Save the choir of tears for tomorrow - this evening is all about making the most of your free time and staying positive. The quirky world-famous water puppet performance in Red River Delta makes for the perfect send off, should you fancy opting for something a bit different.

timeline.title: Day 12: Depart Hanoi
timeline.description: Enjoy one final breakfast with the squad this morning before the trip wraps up. Hug it out and make plans to reunite sometime soon - Latin America, perhaps?

name: Vietnam Explorer
summary: Become a Vietnam Explorer as we travel north from Ho Chi Minh City to Hanoi covering all the highlights and hidden gems this incredible country. Get a cultural insight into its not too distant past, visit the sand dunes of Mui Ne, stunning beaches, breathtaking caves and national parks and finish off with a private island getaway in Halong Bay. The perfect amount of time to spend in this amazing country.
highlights: Explore the hidden gems of the incredible Vietnam
Learn to make a lantern and cook traditional dishes
Discover the historic Hue - country's former capital
Enjoy yoga classes, outdoor cinema and massages
Cruise the emerald waters of Ha Long Bay and relax

timeline.title: Day 1 - Airport Pick Up
timeline.description: Today is arrival day; feel free to arrive any time. You will be picked up from the airport by one of our drivers, who will be waiting for you. Then head to the hotel where your group leader will be waiting for you. Get excited to meet your new travels buddies for dinner and drinks in the evening.

timeline.title: DAY 2 - CITY ORIENTATION & WAR MUSEUM
timeline.description: Spend the day getting to know your new surroundings & indulge in culture & history with a walking tour of the city, before visiting the National War Museum. Tonight we head north to our first coastal destination, Mui Ne.

timeline.title: DAY 3 - MUI NE
timeline.description: This afternoon, you will get to try your hand at sandboarding down the picturesque dunes of Mui Ne, visit the Fairy stream and enjoy the beautiful scenery in open top style jeeps. We’ll finish the day off with some delicious dinner and a night out on the beach town!

timeline.title: day 4 - Explore Mui Ne
timeline.description: Spend the morning relaxing by the pool and exploring the town. In the afternoon, we hop on a bus to Nha Trang and spend a night roaming around the markets or enjoy dinner and drinks with a beach view.

timeline.title: day 5 & 6 - ninhvana beach hideaway
timeline.description: We leave Nha Trang early morning & will have a spot of breakfast before we jump onto our shuttle bus to spend the next two nights in Ninhvana. This epic spot is a backpackers paradise. It is up to you how you spend your time. You can choose from paddle boarding, kayaking, bike tours, guided trekking, and yoga classes. Facilities also include 2 swimming pools, beach volleyball courts, outdoor cinema & a basketball court. The perfect hideaway.

timeline.title: day 7 - TRAVEL DAY
timeline.description: Enjoy a leisurely morning & make the most of the inclusions of this magical place. We head back to Nha Trang late afternoon & arrive in time for our night bus to Hoi An. You should feel relaxed & raring to go for the next leg of our adventure after your time at Ninhavna.

timeline.title: day 8 - hoi an
timeline.description: In and around Hoi An, Ho Chi Minh CityWe arrive early morning into Hoi An, drop our bags to our hotel, and enjoy a complimentary breakfast on arrival. As they prepare our rooms we head out to join a traditional Hoi An lantern making class where we learn how to make our own miniature lanterns. The afternoon is free for you to relax after a long journey, or you can explore the town’s markets & tailors.

timeline.title: DAY 9 - BAMBOO BASKET BOAT TRIP
timeline.description: Start the day with a bike tour around Hoi An old town and lunch at the locals family home. Then spend the afternoon crab fishing with the locals as we explore the 7 hectare water coconut woods in traditional bamboo basket boats. The late afternoon is free to chill or explore the lantern filled streets.

timeline.title: DAY 10 - HAI VAN PASS
timeline.description: An adventure filled day as we leave Hoi An in open-top Jeeps & hit the Hai Van Pass, featured as the ‘Top Gear Experience’ it’s the perfect way to travel to Hue. Stop for a spot of lunch (included) and enjoy a nice swim in the sea before heading off again. On arrival to Hue we check into our new hotel & head into town for dinner and a few drinks in the evening.

timeline.title: Day 11 - IMPERIAL CITY & cooking class
timeline.description: Today it’s time to explore the historic imperial city of Hue. We head off to the Royal Palace where we take in the history of the nation`s former capital city before joining a local cooking school to learn how to make some traditional Vietnemese dishes. After we’re full of delicious food, we then head over via bus to the small town of Phong Nha, where we arrive early evening & just in time to enjoy a few drinks in one of the local bars.

timeline.title: Day 12 - PHONG NHA NATIONAL PARK
timeline.description: In and around Nha TrangParadise Cave is a UNESCO World Heritage site, & is famous for being one of the longest cave systems in the world at 31 km. We spend the day exploring the caves, which are situated inside Phong Nha National Park. In the evening we jump on an overnight bus to Hanoi.

timeline.title: day 13 - hanoi
timeline.description: In and around HanoiWe arrive early morning into Hanoi & head straight to our hotel to check in. As the rooms are still being prepared, we check out a local cafe and experience how to make traditional egg coffee which is a famous drink in Hanoi. In the early afternoon, we’ll visit the famous Hanoi train street and have the rest of the afternoon free for you to chill or explore the city on your own.

timeline.title: day 14 - Ha long Bay
timeline.description: We leave early by bus & boat to head to the famous Castaway Island in Ha Long Bay. Once checked into our beachside accommodation, we enjoy lunch with the most amazing view before an afternoon of watersports & an evening of beach partying.

timeline.title: day 15 - Ha long Bay Boat trip
timeline.description: We spend our full day aboard a traditional junk boat cruising through Ha Long Bay. During the trip we stop off to kayak through ancient caves & a network of lagoons whilst looking out for monkeys, before relaxing on the boat during the afternoon with plenty of swim stops.

timeline.title: day 16 - Travel to hanoi
timeline.description: After a few big nights on our private island, we enjoy another lay in before enjoying our last beachfront lunch, before making the journey back to Hanoi where we check in to our accommodation for our final night together as a group.

timeline.title: day 17 - chilled check out
timeline.description: It's time to say goodbye to one another as everyone heads off on their separate ways. Whether you’re continuing around Southeast Asia, or heading to the airport to go home, your Group Leader will help you to get you where you’re going.

name: Vietnam Highlights
summary: Vietnam Highlights is the perfect way for a taste of Vietnam's best in a short amount of time. Experience the hustle and bustle of Ho Chi Minh City & Hanoi, relax and soak up the rays on a beach in Nha Trang, hit Hoi An by bike & chill out in the amazing scenery of Hue. Later, sit back & discover the amazing limestone formations of Halong Bay aboard a traditional junk boat as you indulge in Vietnam's coolest spots.
highlights: Take a tour of the Marble Mountains, Da Nang
Visit the wild grottos of the Sung Sot Caves
Learn how to make fresh Vietnamese food, Hoi An

timeline.title: Day 4: Nha Trang to Hoi An
timeline.description: In and around Hoi AnAfter a zippy flight north & a short coastal drive we find ourselves in a canal town overflowing with beauty and ancient history.With Japanese, Chinese, Vietnamese and European influences, Hoi An has no shortage of charm and architectural interest. Bike riding through rice fields, roaming the old quarter & ordering custom made clothes at an artful tailor are just some of the activities that will colour our day.
