timeline.description: Pick up at the train station when you arrive and transfer to Sapa by a tourist shared bus. Early check in is possible when you arrive if the room available otherwise we will provide you a basic room where you can have shower. Start the trip at 9:30 as below. First start of 6km of walking down to the south east of Sapa along the side of Muong Hoa valley to Y Linh Ho village of the Black H’mong. Continue a 2km-trekking down to Lao Chai village, through terraced rice fields to Ta Van village of the Dzay minority people. Lunch at a local family, it gives you a worth chance for you to learn about the local house architecture which is full of their daily life styles and exclusive custom. Enjoy the landscapes…on the way. Last trek is about 2Km to the bus stop in Tavan then get back to Sapa by jeep or minivan..  Breakfast, Lunch and dinner are all included. Overnight at the hotel in Sapa.  Trekking level: 6/10  10Km trekking, 8Km driving from Tavan village back to Sapa

timeline.title: Day 4: Cat Cat & Sin Chai
timeline.description: A walk down to the South-west of Sapa (around 4 km) to visit Cat Cat village of the Black H’mong. Relax at the food of the stunning waterfall and the vestige of a hydroelectric power station that was constructed by the French during the colonial time in Vietnam. Enjoy picnic lunch by the side of the river, and then next 3 km to Sin Chai, the village located at the foot of Fansipan Mountain, “the roof of Vietnam and Indochina”. From here you can enjoy huge stunning landscapes before climbing up on the way a jeep to return to Sapa.  Breakfast, Lunch and dinner are all included.  Trekking level: 4/10  7KM trekking, 3Km driving from Cat Cat back to Sapa. Tourist bus to back Hanoi. Overnight 3 star hotel in Hanoi

timeline.title: Day 5: Ha Noi – Ha Long Bay – Lunch – Titop Island – Surprising Cave – Sunset party – Dinner – Fishing
timeline.description: 7:45 – 8:30: Our guide will meet you at your hotel. The shuttle bus or private car pick up. Enjoy the peaceful scenery as we travel through the countryside, farmlands and Red River delta. – 12:00 – 12:30 Arriving Tuan Chau Marina .Welcome aboard the cruise . Meet the captain , crew and join us for welcome drink as we tell you about life onboard. – Check into your cabin . Time to refresh and unwind. – Served  a delectable lunch while cruising ahead to Ha Long  Bay Afternoon Activities: – Explore the Surprising Cave – the most beautiful cave in Ha long Bay. It is one of the widest grottoes in Ha Long Bay with thousands of stalactites and stalagmites. -Back to the APRICOT Cruise, We will take you to visit the Titop Island – swimming – Climbing up to the Top of the Island – take the best view ofHalong Bay in the Summer time. – Continue cruising to the quiet area while enjoy beautiful seascape on the way. – After that, come back to the boat, enjoy the Sunset Party on sundeck (free wine & fresh fruits). Evening Relaxing: Dinner is served. Socialize with other guests, take part in board games, fish for squid, or just laze around. Overnight on board: Clean air – conditioned rooms with private washroom

timeline.title: Day 6: Tai Chi – BreAkfast – KAYAKING– Cooking demonstration – lunch – your hotel
timeline.description: Morning in the bay: – 6:30 – 6:45 Startyour day with Tai Chi exercises or a photo hunt – 7:00 am: Have breakfast on board while the boat starts cruising to the Natural Preservation Zone. – DO KAYAKING in 30-45 minutes. – 9:30am :We board the cruise again .Take time to refresh and relax before checking out. Bags can be left in luggage store . – Continue your cruise pass through the Bay, passing Ba Hang fishing village, Dog Islet, and more… – Join in the Cooking Class , teaching you how to make our specifically (Spring rolls) before an early lunch is served . – 11: 30 – 12:00 Disembark at the harbor, Tuan Chau Marina. – Transfer to minibus or private and return to Hanoi – Arrival back at your hotel approximately 16:30/17:00 Overnight at hotel in Hanoi

timeline.title: DAY 7: Return the Noi Bai airpot and fly back to your home( Breakfast )
timeline.description:
-Take a rest in your hotel. - Our Car will pick you up at your hotel and take you to the airport and say Goodbye. Ends Package tourEnd point
 Noi Bai International Airport, Noi Bai International Airport, Sóc Sơn, Huyện Sóc Sơn, Hanoi 140800, Vietnam 00:00 - 23:00

name: Vietnam Southern Tour in Focus from Saigon to Mekong Delta, Nha Trang and Da Lat
summary: This tour brings you many chances to discover the wealth of beauty and culture that South Vietnam has to offer, beginning with a comprehensive sightseeing tour of Ho Chi Minh city, the fastest-growing metropolis in SE Asia, the mighty Mekong Delta and the Cu Chi tunnels. Then, relax on Nha Trang beach – ranks among the top of all beaches in Vietnam and enjoy Dat Lat – A little Paris – where many couples come to visit for their Honeymoon.

timeline.title: DAY 1: ARRIVAL – HO CHI MINH CITY
timeline.description:
In and around Ho Chi Minh CityOn arrival at Tan San Nhat Airport, you are met by our guide and transferred to hotel. The bustling Ho Chi Minh City, still called Saigon by many locals, is a center of commerce, finance, culture and tourism in Vietnam. This metropolis, contradiction of its northern counterpart, is crowded with bikes and motorbikes, excited by numerous shopping areas and sidewalk cafes. ( If time permits) we stroll around the down town to explore the different local ways of life. O/N in Ho Chi Minh City.Start point
 Your Hotel, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam 08:00

timeline.title: DAY 2: HO CHI MINH SIGHTSEEING CITY TOUR & CU CHI TUNNELS (B/L/-)
timeline.description: In and around Cu Chi Tunnels Today we spend a half day exploring the captivating Ho Chi Minh City. The most places of interest are located near the town center. We pass by the now-demolished wartime American Embassy on our way to the Reunification Palace. This famous edifice was a former residence of the President of Southern Vietnam until end of April 1975. Close to the palace are some striking French colonial structures including the Notre Dame Cathedral and the Old Sai Gon Post Office. We follow these with a visit to the Jade Emperor Pagoda and the War Remnant Museum with a wealth of images from the notorious conflicts. The sightseeing ends up with a walk around the retail Ben Thanh Market where anything and everything is for sale! Afternoon: Transfer about 30km north-west of Ho Chi Minh City to Cu Chi town. Cu Chi tunnels were used as the base from which the Vietnamese mounted their operations of the Tet Offensive in 1968. The incredible underground network in Cu Chi stretched over 200 kilometres and became legendary during the American war. The extensive tunnels have been specially constructed with living areas, weapon factories, filed hospitals, command centres, plus accommodation. Today we have an excursion to Cu Chi Tunnels to visit an exposition hall and a widened section of the tunnels to get a feel of the underground life. There are also possibilities to fire off rounds from an AK47 or MK16 at the nearby rifle range O/N in Ho Chi Minh City.

timeline.title: DAY 3: HO CHI MINH CITY PACKAGE TOUR – MEKONG CRUISING TOURS (B/L/-)
timeline.description: Breakfast at hotel Transfer about 30km north-west of Ho Chi Minh City to Cu Chi town. Cu Chi tunnels were used as the base from which the Vietnamese mounted their operations of the Tet Offensive in 1968. The incredible underground network in Cu Chi stretched over 200 kilometres and became legendary during the American war. The extensive tunnels have been specially constructed with living areas, weapon factories, filed hospitals, command centres, plus accommodation. Today we have an excursion to Cu Chi Tunnels to visit an exposition hall and a widened section of the tunnels to get a feel of the underground life. There are also possibilities to fire off rounds from an AK47 or MK16 at the nearby rifle range. In the afternoon, we travel by roads to the Mekong Delta. This plain region boasts the largest rice bowl of Vietnam. On arrival in My Tho we board a boat navigating around the intricate small canals, which is a great way to observe the local lifestyle close-up and catch a view dotted by many islands. The exciting river trip will pass by the lush green vegetation towards the famous Unicorn Island where we have a chance to stroll around an orchard, taste many seasonal fruits and see farmers at work. We navigate some narrower canals using small rowing boats to Ben Tre Province for an interesting visit to some local industries. The extra enjoyment is a lunch at one of the famous local eating spots. We drive back to Ho Chi Minh. O/N in Ho Chi Minh City.

timeline.title: DAY 4: HO CHI MINH CITY TRAVEL PACKAGE TOUR – DA LAT VACATION (B/-/-)
timeline.description: The journey northwards begins as we depart Ho Chi Minh and pass through the many tea and coffee plantations to the hill station of Da Lat, sometimes known as the “City of Eternal Spring”. The drive is long but views are fantastic all along the way. Once arriving in Da Lat we can soak up the cool climate as much as we want by spending our time to wander around and catch our first glimpse of this town. The influence of the French is evident in local culture and architecture since Da Lat was founded as a hill retreat for the colonials to escape the oppressive heat in the coastal plains and the chaos of Saigon. This charming town is set around a lake and surrounded by forests, waterfalls and rolling countryside.

timeline.title: DAY 5: DA LAT – NHA TRANG TOUR (B/-/-)
timeline.description: In and around Nha TrangPick up  from hotels, drive on the quiet Provincial Road 725 , pass Camly airport, vegetable and flower fields, forests... Today we enjoy a drive through the Mang Linh Coffee plantation, Van Thanh Flower village, Cricket farm, Rice wine distillery, the rural market of Nam Ban village, Cuong Hoan silk factory, enjoy the impressive Elephant waterfall roaring like thunder! We follow it with a trip to the sacred Linh An Pagoda. Transfer to Nha Trang and have a check in at your hotel in Nha Trang. O/N in Nha Trang.

timeline.title: DAY 6: NHA TRANG BEACH TOUR (B/L/-)
timeline.description: The turquoise water surrounding a string of islands and the white sandy beach stretching the whole length of Nha Trang City make it one of Vietnam’s premier beach resorts. We board a boat to explore the coastal islands. The ROBINSON OASIS is our first stop. Today we have plenty of time to enjoy swimming and snorkeling on the blue and clear water or simply lazing on a beach. Scuba Diving (your own fee). The thrilling boat trip continues towards TRI NGUYEN AQUARIUM with hundreds of nice and precious marine creatures are bred in the lake, looking a real marine museum. By mid afternoon we cruise back to Nha Trang Pier and complete our day with a short city tour. The impressive LIVE SHOW MUSIC with more than 20 languages and the FLOATING BAR with Sexy Funny Dance  17:00  END THE TRIP AND TAKE YOU BACK TO MAINLAND. O/N in Nha Trang.

timeline.title: DAY 7: NHA TRANG– HO CHI MINH CITY TRAVEL PACKAGES (B/L/-)
timeline.description: After breakfast at the hotel, around 8h00 back down to sea level and Ho Chi Minh City (Saigon). It is around an 8-hour drive, on the way to Ho Chi Minh we can stop by Bao Loc, the land of tea, coffee and mulberry. Dambri Waterfall are surrounded by hills of mulberry, tea, and palm trees. Visitors can also enjoy a cruise on the clear lake. Arrival in Ho Chi Minh will be late afternoon. O/N in Ho Chi Minh City.

timeline.title: DAY 8: HO CHI MIMH CITY - DEPARTURE (B-/-/)
timeline.description: Breakfast at the hotel. Free for your own activities until transfer to Tan Son Nhat airport for departure.

name: Vietnam North-East Adventure tour to Lang Son, Cao Bang, Bac Kan
summary: The North East mountainous areas of Ba Be Lake, Cao Bang and Lang Son offer opportunities for rugged jeep rides and stunning trekking routes. It is the less- known area of the north and is ideal for more hardy travelers craving a glimpse of some of the more remote ethnic minority people…

timeline.title: Day 1: Arrival – Hanoi Sightseeing Tours
timeline.description: In and around HanoiOn arrival at Hanoi Airport, you are met by our tour guide and transferred to your hotel in Hanoi downtown. We will have a tour briefing in the afternoon and welcome dinner with Vietnamese delights. Overnight in Hanoi.  Summary:  Hotel transfer: Private AC vehicle – 45mins  Meal: Welcome dinner  Accommodation: Hotel in Hanoi

timeline.title: Day 2: Sightseeing Tours to Lang Son – Trekking Tours to Na Pang Village (That Khe) via Lang Son
timeline.description: After having breakfast in the hotel, we head north to Lang Son. Upon arrival in Lang Son we visit to Tam Thanh Cave before having lunch in local restaurant. After lunch we continue riding to That Khe, a small quiet town. The afternoon ride is very nice as we drive through beautiful area with forested mountains and peaceful tribal villages. Arrival in That Khe in late afternoon. We will walk to Na Pang Village in Trang Dinh district of Lang Son, here we will have dinner and overnight with a Tay family on their traditional house on stilt.   Summary:   Transfer: AC vehicle – 5hrs   Trek: 10km – Moderate  Meal: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner   Accommodation: Homestay

timeline.title: Day 3: That Khe Trekking Tours to Na Pang Village – Pac Khoang Village – Homestay Tours
timeline.description: Breakfast at the homestay. We will start our trek to Pac Khoang – a village of Dzao ethnic minority. Today we will trek along valleys with on small paths that only used by the locals to go to their farms and surrounding villages. We will cross some small streams and tackle some easy hill slopes. Picnic lunch on the way. We would reach Pac Khoang around 5pm. Tonight, we will have dinner and overnight with a local family.  Summary :  Transfer: 10km by van  Trek: 16km – Moderate  Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner   Accommodation: Homestay

timeline.title: Day 4: Pac Khoang Village Trekking Adventure Tours to Dong Khe and Na Nieng Village – Homestay Tours at Pac Khoang Village
timeline.description: Breakfast and begin the trek around 8.30am. This morning we trek mainly downhill to Dong Khe where will have a rest for lunch. Dong Khe was the first major battle of the first Indochina war in 1950 between Viet Minh and the French and the war ended with Viet Minh victory, marked with the national hero Vo Nguyen Giap.  The morning trek is on village road and jungle trails with nice view of rice and corn fields along valleys. We reach Dong Khe at noon. After lunch we continue trekking to Na Nieng Village which is home of Tay ethnic minority. The trek in the afternoon is a bit harder than the one in the morning since we have more uphill terrain to tackle. We reach Pac Khoang Village around 5pm. Today we will have dinner and stay overnight in a local house.  Summary   Trek: 16km– Moderate  Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner   Accommodation: Homestay

timeline.title: Day 5: Na Nieng Village Trekking tours to La Village – Homestay Tour at La Village
timeline.description: Having breakfast in the homestay before starting the adventure of the day. Today we trek up and down on some forested limestone mountains to reach La, a beautiful village of Tay ethnic minority located in the valley among the magnificent mountain ranges. Today we have some stops for refreshment in remote tribal village of Na Nieng village which is surrounded by the lush forest and wild life, and we encounter during the trek. Dinner and overnight at homestay.  Summary :  Trek: 16km – Moderate  Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner   Accommodation: Homestay

timeline.title: Day 6: La Village Trekking Tours to Ta Lung – Cao Bang Adventure Tours
timeline.description: Breakfast at homestay and leave the village for Ta Lung, the border gate with China for 1 hour and one of the most dynamic economic zone of Phuc Hoa districts, Cao Bang province. We will trek through jungle and cross some small streams. Near Ta Lung we cross Bang Giang River on bamboo raft. The river flowing through Cao Bang ends at Tà Lùng border Gate, Hmong rural commune, Phuc Hòa (at the southeast of Cao Bang) before it returns to Guangxi, China. Lunch in Ta Lung before we take a van transfer to Cao Bang Town. Check in hotel in Cao Bang and spend the rest of the day relaxing in local café or wander around the town. Dinner and overnight in Cao Bang.  Summary :  Trek: 15km – Introductory  Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner  Accommodation: Hotel in Cao Bang

timeline.title: Day 7: Cao Bang Adventure Tours to Ba Be National Park.
timeline.description: Breakfast in Cao Bang and take a transfer to Ba Be National Park, popular Vietnam’s natural complex mainly consisting of Ba Be Lake, the supposed largest natural fresh water lake in Vietnam. The 150-m altitude makes it the Vietnam’s highest lake above sea level. Along the way, stop at Cho Ra Town, we will have lunch in a local restaurant before taking a relaxing boat trip on Nang River and enter the beautiful Ba Be Lake. We will cruise through Puong Cave, it’s about 30m high and 300m long, and completely passes through a mountain. A navigable river flows through the cave, making for an interesting boat trip. It costs 300, 000 VND for a boat and takes three hours. After the boat trip we reach Pac Ngoi, a village of Tay ethnic minority. Dinner and overnight in local house.  Summary   Transfer: 2.5 hrs  Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner   Accommodation: Homestay

timeline.title: Day 8: Kayaking Tours in Ba Be National Park
timeline.description: Breakfast at the homestay. We will have a short motorcycle ride to starting point where we begin a short walk through jungle. At some resting points we can have great view of Babe Lake. After 1hr trekking we descend to the lake shore and cross a bridge to An Ma Island. Visit to the temple on the island before we start kayaking. Leave the island we paddle to Dau Dang Waterfall we will have a picnic lunch in a beautiful natural setting of the waterfall. After lunch we paddle back to Babe Lake. If weather permits we can swim in the emeraude cool water of the lake. Paddle back to Pac Ngoi village for another night at the homestay.  Summary   Kayaking: 5hrs   Trekking: 1hr   Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner  Accommodation: Homestay

timeline.title: Day 9: Ba Be National Park Adventure Tours to Hanoi
timeline.description: After breakfast we take a short boat ride to the National Park Dock where we get on van for the ride back to Hanoi. Lunch on the way. Back to Hanoi at around 5pm. Check into your hotel and free afterward.  Tonight, we’ll have farewell dinner and overnight in Hanoi.  Summary   Transfer Babe – Hanoi: 240km   Boat cruise: 15mins  Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner   Accommodation: hotel in Hanoi

timeline.title: Day 10: Hanoi – Departure
timeline.description: Breakfast in the hotel and free until you are transferred to the airport for flight home.  Summary  Aiport transfer: 50mins  Meals: Breakfast

name: SEE ALL EAT WELL: Vietnam Group Tour - 10 days
summary: When it comes to food experience, Vietnam owns a soft, memorable and convincing side that can satisfy the craziest hunger of worldwide foodies. For 10 days, join in the Vietnam small group tour, travellers will make the most of Vietnam, plus, taste all way from Hanoi to Ho Chi Minh City with iconic destinations and delightful dishes promoting best local flavours in each region.

timeline.title: Day 1: HANOI ARRIVAL: WELCOME TO VIETNAM
timeline.description:
In and around HanoiXin chào! Welcome to Hanoi, Vietnam. Hanoi, one of Asia’s most enchanting cities, is full of culture, history and the engaging contradictions of a rapidly developing and deeply traditional society. You are greeted by your guide and driver at Noi Bai International Airport for your transfer to the hotel.  We start our evening with a welcome dinner hosted in a lovely local restaurant where you can taste the various ethnic gastronomy specialties of Northern Vietnam. During dinner will learn about two important aspects of Vietnamese life that will prove very useful during your trip – basic language and chopsticks handling skills. We will teach you the most common phrases and expressions that can used during the many encounters to be expected on our trip; and do not fear the use of chopsticks, we will teach you all the tips and tricks that can be used to really enhance your Vietnamese experience.  Overnight in Hanoi.  Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner  Accommodation: May de ville Old QuarterStart point
 Pick up at any arrival Time, Noi Bai International Terminal 2, Sân Bay Quốc Tế Nội Bài, Huyện Sóc Sơn, Hanoi 140800, Vietnam

timeline.title: Day 2: SLICES OF LIFE IN HANOI
timeline.description: Get ready to see Hanoi as very few others do. This tour is the perfect blend of iconic cultural sites of Hanoi and offbeat districts to sample some genuine local life. The guide meets you in the hotel lobby and off we go. After a short car transfer to the South of Hanoi through a busy urban area, we veer off the main road and enter a very special district. It suddenly feels like stepping back in time, into the 1960’s when Hanoi was a quaint capital populated mostly by modest workers. Wander around these narrow alleys covered in colourful market stalls, feel the incredible vibe and let the guide tell you the story of these unusual big yellow buildings. We have a coffee break before transferring to the Temple of Literature. We visit the little gem of architecture and huge piece of history. For lunch, we suggest to walk to a nearby street food shop. There are several options, our favourite would be the Bun Cha flame-grilled pork meat served with sticky rice noodles.  In the afternoon, we continue to the garden of the Presidential Palace, where you can also see the One-Pillar Pagoda and the house on stilts where Ho Chi Minh lived. Afterwards, we have a quick fresh beer in a local bia hoi, the Vietnamese version of a pub. We return to the hotel in the afternoon. The rest of the day is at your own leisure.  Overnight in Hanoi.  Meals: Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner  Accommodation: May de ville Old Quarter

timeline.title: Day 3: TRANQUILITY IN HALONG BAY
timeline.description: We gather in the lobby at 8.00 AM for our departure to the majestic Halong Bay. We drive across the Red River delta and reach the coast a little before noon. We then embark on a beautifully crafted junk for an overnight cruise in the legendary seascape of Halong Bay. Once on board, we are served a delicious seafood-based lunch, while the surrounding limestone outcrops make for a truly magical setting. In the afternoon, we reach a less travelled area where we will devote ourselves to pure relaxation. The program is not fixed and depends on the time of the year and weather, but there will be an opportunity to visit a cave as well as explore a floating village or do a little bit of kayaking over the course of these 2 days. We end the day on the sundeck as the sun sets on this magical seascape. This evening, you can enjoy an aperitif or attend a cooking demonstration before dinner. Overnight in a comfortable private cabin with an en-suite bathroom.   *Note:  Cruise itinerary and schedule are subject to change due to weather, tide levels and operating conditions. Swimming or kayaking excursions may be cancelled due to poor weather. The tour leader will not be accompanying guests on the shuttle bus or boat. There will be an on-board cruise manager who will be available for guests should they have any questions or concerns.  Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner Accommodation: Bhaya Classic Cruise – Deluxe Cabin

timeline.title: Day 4: FROM EMERALD WATERS TO THE ANCIENT TOWN HOI AN
timeline.description: In and around Hoi An, Ho Chi Minh CityFor those early birds, start the day with a Tai Chi class or enjoy a cup of tea or coffee as the sun rises and illuminates the surrounding seascape. We then continue our exploration of the bay. Upon returning to the boat, check-out of your cabin and enjoy a lunch while cruising back to the pier. We disembark and transfer to Hanoi airport for your flight to Danang. On arrival in Danang, you are greeted and driven to your hotel in Hoi An.  Overnight in Hoi An.  Meals: Breakfast, Brunch Accommodation: Blue Sky Hotel

timeline.title: Day 5: UNIQUE FLAVOURS OF HOI AN
timeline.description: This morning after breakfast, we start our walk across the enchanting ancient town of Hoi An. Follow your guide as you meander your way through the beautiful streets and narrow alleys, which are bordered by ancient yellow-walled houses. We reach a market where you can spend some time exploring the colourful stalls and the variety of foods and souvenirs on offer. Try some local delicacies before we venture further into the town. The guide will show you various places of interest and will also arrange some spontaneous food tastings as we walk.  Afternoon is at your own leisure.  Overnight in Hoi An.  Meals: Breakfast, Lunch Accommodation: Blue Sky Hotel

timeline.title: Day 6: GETTING ACTIVE IN HOI AN
timeline.description: At 8.00 AM this morning, our guide will pick you up from your hotel, and equipped with bicycles you will set off directly towards Duy Vinh Commune. The picturesque cycling route is highlighted with rice fields, local gardens and markets. Stop as often as you wish to take photographs or engage in some laidback chats with locals (using our guide as a translator). There is also time to pay a visit to a local family who are still practicing the craft of weaving sedge mattresses using traditional techniques.  After about 1.5-hour cycling, it is time to hop into a kayak and off we go to explore the river. As you paddle towards Cam Thanh cocopalm forest, you will notice that the area is a large mangrove ecosystem unique to Hoi An, and the scenery is just spectacular. To end an active morning, your lunch will be served at a local farm with tasty Vietnamese food. Take as much time to relax as you wish before transferring back to your hotel. The rest of the day is at your own leisure to enjoy the town or some time relaxing on the beach.  Overnight in Hoi An.  Meals: Breakfast, Lunch Accommodation: Blue Sky Hotel

timeline.title: Day 7: READY, SET, SAIGON
timeline.description: You are met in the lobby of your hotel for a short transfer to Danang airport. Embark on your flight to Ho Chi Minh City, the big metropolis of the South. You are greeted upon arrival and driven to your hotel in the city centre, historically called Saigon. Dinner is served at a local restaurant.  Overnight in Saigon.  Meals: Breakfast, Dinner Accommodation: Muong Thanh Centre Hotel

timeline.title: Day 8: DISCOVERING THE LIVELY DISTRICTS
timeline.description: Your guide meets you in the hotel lobby at 8.00 AM and off we go for an original morning to explore the less travelled trails of this fascinating city. Prepare to travel back in time as we first head to District 3, where we visit the oldest café in town which was opened in 1938. Enjoy a refreshment, before we immerse ourselves into the genuine Saigon popular culture. Walk through a massive street-market, as you gently elbow your way between conical hats and mobile street food sellers to exit at Chung Cu. Here you will find yourself in the heart of Saigon’s working-class, which remains mostly unchanged since the 1960’s. Marvel at the size of these old residential buildings as we walk through and into the Ho Thi Ky Quarter. A place known for its spectacular flower market, and its maze of quiet narrow streets. A place also surprisingly famous for its Khmer delicacies since the 1990’s. Here you will be able to enjoy some of these traditional snacks. We continue deeper into District 10, a fantastic destination where every street corner holds a surprise and a chance to amaze you. Our urban adventure ends at one of the most famous street-food streets in the city, time for lunch!  In the afternoon, we take a digestive walk around the colonial buildings of the District 1. We start at the Independence Palace, continue to the Notre-Dame Cathedral and the Saigon Central Post office before we get to the beautiful Nguyen Hue street where the City Hall stands. To complete the day, we take you to taste a few brews in one of the most famous craft beer taprooms of the country, located in Pasteur Street.  We transfer back to your hotel afterwards, and end the day at your own leisure.  Overnight in Saigon.  Meals: Breakfast, Lunch Accommodation: Muong Thanh Centre Hotel

timeline.title: Day 9: A DAY IN MEKONG DELTA
timeline.description: Departing from your hotel at 8am, we drive out of the metropolis and after about 2 and a half hours we reach a less travelled region of the delta, about 30-kilometres away from the mouth of the mighty Mekong River. We hop onto our private boat and start our exploration. We will meet some friendly locals, learn more about their daily lives and navigate the Mekong. After visiting a local factory and an ancient communal house, we reach a small island for lunch at a local guesthouse.  In the afternoon, we visit a honey-bee farm before hoping onto bikes and cycling narrow pathways across the island. We stop at another local farm to unveil the secret of Sâm jelly and sample it. We continue across some orchards and transfer onto a small sampan to explore a thick mangrove. We return to the mainland, where our vehicle awaits to return us to Ho Chi Minh City. We arrive at your hotel in the late afternoon.  Overnight in Saigon.  Meals: Breakfast, Lunch Accommodation: Muong Thanh Centre Hotel

timeline.title: Day 10: TAM BIET SAIGON
timeline.description:
The day is free at your own leisure until your transfer to the Tan Son Nhat International Airport for your departure flight. We wish you a pleasant flight!End point
 Drop off at the Airport (Flexible date within 48 hours after tour ends), Tan Son Nhat International Airport, Trường Sơn, Quận Tân Bình, Hồ Chí Minh 736900, Vietnam

name: Northern Vietnam Tour to Hanoi, Halong Bay and Sapa
summary: This 8- day tour offers all the richness of the Northern Vietnam key sites, its ancient culture of Hanoi capital city combined with magnificent scenery of Halong Bay, friendly people in Sapa. Every aspect of the trip is exciting, from the Old Quarter of Hanoi, to the top luxury cruise on Halong Bay and the unique culture of the ethnic minority people in Sapa.

timeline.title: DAY 1: HANOI – ARRIVAL (-/-/-)
timeline.description: In and around HanoiUpon arrival in Noi Bai Airport, you’ll receive cordial welcome and comfortable transfer to hotel. If time permits, enjoy an orientation tour by cyclo around the old quarter streets, an interesting introduction of the city. Like other big cities, Hanoi is hustling and bustling, with thousands of people riding motorbikes, the most convenient means of transportation in the city.  O/N in Hanoi.

timeline.title: DAY 2: HANOI CITY TOUR –NIGHT TRAIN TO SAPA (B/-/-)
timeline.description: Today you’ll be on a full day tour to discover the most outstanding attractions of Hanoi. First, pay a visit to the complex of memorials to Ho Chi Minh to know his amazing life. Continue to the One Pillar Pagoda and the Temple of Literature to gain understanding of the two driving forces in Vietnam culture.  Afternoon visit the Museum of Ethnology which exhibits a large collection of artifacts about the cultures of the 54 ethnic groups in the country. Next, hustle back to the peaceful Hoan Kiem area since there is a water puppet show at the popular Thang Long Water Puppet Theater awaits. Water puppet is a unique traditional art form and expression of cultural identity. The shows capture Vietnamese traditions; farming, tending buffaloes, and catching fish; entertainment, like swimming contests and lion dancing; and historical legends with traditional music.  The one-hour show is a fun and insightful look into Vietnamese culture enjoyed by both adults and children. Later, you will be transferred to a hotel to have a break and shower before boarding the night train to Sapa.  Overnight on the train.

timeline.title: DAY 3: LAO CAI –SAPA- TREKKING TO LAO CHAI, TA VAN (B/L/-)
timeline.description: The train arrives at Lao Cai station early this morning. Transfer to Sapa where your breakfast is prepared & served. Then, you’ll join us on a trip to the villages of Lao Chai & Ta Van, a home of the H’mong and Dzay. The day is devoted to a beautiful hike through the breathtaking scenery of Sa Pa valley. On road, you’ll interact with the hospitable locals, pass the beautiful rice terraces, a small suspension bridge and fascinating collection of rock carvings. These engravings depict some beautiful images of man, stilt houses and some beautiful decorative patterns. Today, we’ll share our lunch in a village home.  Overnight in Sapa.

timeline.title: DAY 4: SAPA EASY TREKKING TO CAT CAT, THAC BAC (B/-/-)
timeline.description: After breakfast at hotel, find yourself among hundreds of the locals while you are leisurely trekking to Cat Cat village which is inhabited by the Hmong. On arrival at the village, take a visit to a home to learn how they live. Relax by a beautiful waterfall before pick up and transfer to Thac Bac, another highlight of Sapa that we should never miss.  Back to the hotel and spend the rest of your day at leisure.  Overnight in Sapa.

timeline.title: DAY 5: SAPA FREE &EASY- EXPRESS BUS BACK TO HANOI (B/-/-)
timeline.description: After breakfast, enjoy your free time until a transfer overland by bus back to Hanoi.  Overnight in Hanoi

timeline.title: DAY 6: HANOI –HALONG BAY, OVERNIGHT ON BOAT (B/-/-)
timeline.description: After having breakfast at the hotel, we journey north- east to Vietnam’s greatest natural wonder, Halong Bay. On arrival, we’ll board a beautiful traditional junk and spend a full day and night cruising the bay’s 3000 magnificent limestone islets. In the evening when the boat is anchored in the middle of the stunning lagoon, we enjoy a wonderful seafood meal and later there is opportunity for an evening swim from the side of the boat. Kayaks are also available if specified at time of booking.  Spend the night on board.

timeline.title: DAY 7: HALONG BAY - HANOI (B/-/-)
timeline.description: Wake up to fresh coffee before cruising back to the shore. En route the junk weaves through impressive rock formations that invite comparisons from fighting cocks to dragons and even further! After lunch we disembark and return to Hanoi. En route, take a detour to the 500 year pottery village of Bat Trang.  Overnight in Hanoi.

timeline.title: DAY 8: HANOI DEPARTURE (B/-/-)
timeline.description: After breakfast, free until transfer to the airport for your departure flight home.

name: Toughest Northern Vietnam Motorbike Tour to Ba Be, Ha Giang, Sapa, Lai Chau, Son La
summary: Within 8 days, this Northern Vietnam offroad motorbike tour from Hanoi offers you full chance to taste Ha Giang, Ba Be National Park, Ba Be lake, Mai Chau valley and Sa pa – they are the most attractive destinations in North of Vietnam. You will have great album of stunning landscape of mountainous region and colorful hill tribes after 8 day riding motorbike in northern Vietnam. This is one of the most favourite in our Vietnam Motorbike Tours Collection.

timeline.title: Day 1: HANOI MOTORBIKE TOURS TO BA BE LAKE (240 KM)
timeline.description: In and around HanoiThis great motorcycle tour to the north of Vietnam starts at around 8 AM. We try the best to avoid busy city road in the morning until Cho Chu town (in Thai Nguyen province) where we have lunch. After lunch, we surely have enjoyable motorcycle ride to Ba Be because the roads have less traffic and give you a lot of grand mountain view. At about 4 PM. We arrive Pac Ngoi – a beautiful village of Tay people which located peacefully at Ba Be lake’s side. Diner and stay with the Tay’s family. Ba Bể Lake (Vietnamese: Hồ Ba Bể – Ba means “Three”, Bể is from the Tay language word pé, meaning “lake”) is the largest natural lake in Vietnam. It is located in Nam Mẫu commune, Bắc Kạn district, Bắc Kạn Province in the northeastern region of the country. Having been formed approximately 200 million years ago, the lake is surrounded by limestone cliffs, which in turn are covered by primary forests.  The lake comprises three zones named Pé Lầm, Pé Lù, and Pé Lèng. Three rivers, named Năng, Tả Han, and Nam Cường, are the main inflows of the lake. The Năng river enters the lake through a large waterfall called Đầu Đẳng. In the lake there are also three islands, named Án Mã, Khẩu Cúm, and Po Gia Mải (literally “Widow’s Island”). Ba Bể Lake is a featured geographical science and is a biodiversity reservoir. It is a part of the Ba Be National Park. It is home of a range of animals and plants.

timeline.title: Day 2: BABE LAKE MOTORCYCLE TOURS TO MEO VAC (170 KM)
timeline.description: Saying good bye to  the family, we’ll ride motorbike on the back-roads through some rustic villages and the jungle. Then we motorbike across some streams. This promise to be a great day for off-road Vietnam motorbike touring. We will stop in Bao Lac town for lunch and then continue the beautiful motorcycle tour Northern Vietnam to Meo Vac by taking a scenic route climbs over many Passes where we can enjoy beautiful mountain ranges and the Nho Que river.  Arrive at Meo Vac by 5.00PM. Dinner in town, Hotel stay.  Meo Vac Town is located in the heart of the Dong Van Rock Plateau, which was recognized as part of the Global Geo-Park Network in 2009, the Dong Van old quarter is home to age old and unique architecture near Ha Giang Province’s border with China. Therefore, the Motorbike tour to Ha Giang, Dong Van is always the best choice of the motorcyclists.

timeline.title: Day 3: MEO VAC MOTORBIKE TOURS HA GIANG (180 KM)
timeline.description: Today’s ride promises to be the highlight of this motorcycle trip in north Vietnam as we will visit one of the most remote land in Motorbike Tour Around Northern Vietnam – 8 DaysVietnam where we can see many ethnic groups with their unique cultures and imposing mountains such as : Pi Leng Pass – one of the 4 longest and most beautiful passes in North Vietnam, the Rock Plateau, the Vuong palace in Dong Van, The “Heaven Gate” in Quan Ba.   This is for sure the best motorbike ride in Vietnam with many interesting and amazing things in every meter of the road.  Arrive Ha Giang in the late afternoon.Dinner and stay with the other Tay’s family or stay in hotel in Ha Giang city Ha Giang, 300 km away from Hanoi, located at the highest latitude in Vietnam. It is surrounded by Cao Bang, Tuyen Quang, Lao Cai, and Yen Bai. It shares a border with China in the north. Many ethnic minorities, including the Dao, H’mong, Tay, and Nung, live in Ha Giang province Vietnam.

timeline.title: Day 4: HA GIANG MOTORBIKE TOURS TO SA PA (220KM)
timeline.description: Today we head straight towards the North-western mountain where the main Fanxipan Mountain range dominates the road until Sapa. The road is very smooth with a good view of green mountain, rice fields between lovely villages of the hill tribes. After a short break in Lao Cai to see Chinese border, we will have very beautiful motorbike ride up to Sapa. This motorbike ride is up and up till 1.600 meters above sea level. It offers a great  view of mountain with terrace fields and it must be one of the best motorbike ride in North Vietnam. Arrive in Sapa at around 5: 00 pm, overnight at hotel in Sapa.

timeline.title: Day 5: SAPA MOTORBIKE TOURS THAN UYEN (110 KM)
timeline.description: You are free to explore Sapa until 1.30PM, check out hotel and we continue the route to Than Uyen, we will make a splendid climb up from Sapa to the top of the highest road pass in Vietnam (Tram Ton Pass). Crossing into Lai Chau Province at over 2000m above sea level. This is a short motorbike ride but could be the most enjoyable motorbike tour from Sa pa. The ride offers you amazing view of the Hoang Lien mountain ranges for miles and miles. We arrive in Than Uyen by 5.00PM.  Dinner and overnight in hotel.

timeline.title: Day 6: THAN UYEN MOTORBIKE TOURS TO MU CANG CHAI – PHU YEN (220 KM)
timeline.description: We keep riding up and down into a forested and high mountain region populated by H’mong peoples, We will hike up a very high mountain pass before descending into a mountainous tea-growing region. Soon after we follow a long the valley floor covered in a sea of rice surrounded by Hmong and Thai’s villages all the way to Phu Yen. Especially, after lunch in Mu Cang Chai – a famous land for terrace fields so the ride through Mu Cang Chai is another highlight of this Motorcycle tours North Vietnam. Arrive Phu Yen town at 5:00Pm. Overnight at hotel.

timeline.title: Day 7: PHU YEN MOTORCYCLE TOURS TO MAI CHAU VALLEY (150 KM)
timeline.description: It is a short motorbike tour to Mai Chau valley, but it’s also a enjoyable motorbike ride! It offers some different views from the days before with different hill tribes. Right after Phu Yen town, we will have great ride along the Da River lake on the winding road between the river lake and mountains. it is likely a motorcycle tour on the coastline in the central Vietnam.   After crossing the Da river by a ferry, we will motorcycle up and up to Moc Chau plateau where we stop for lunch, then after lunch, we’ll make a turn to the quiet mountain road named Hua Tat – it’s built by the French during the war time and nowadays, it is like a forgotten so the short ride to Mai Chau is also the best part of the Northern Vietnam Motorbike Tour. Arrive Mai Chau at 4:30 PM. Stay in Poom-coong village of the Thai people – Home stay.

timeline.title: Day 8: MAI CHAU MOTORCYCLE TOURS BACK TO HANOI (150KM)
timeline.description: Getting up late, feel the peaceful life of the local by walking around the valley and then start the motorbike ride back to Hanoi at around 10 AM. After 2 beautiful mountain passes – Thung Khe and Doc Cun we will have lunch and then join the high way back to Hanoi. We will be back to the hotel before rush hours in order to end the 8 Day motorbike tour in north Vietnam safely.

name: 9 Days in Northern Vietnam
summary: Exploring Northern Vietnam in 9 Days will give you an unforgettable memory. Discovering the interesting Hanoi old quarter with 36 streets. Visiting ancient Hoa Lu capital in 10th century. Cycling in the local village and rice fields in the countryside to see the local daily life of local farmer. Taking photo of stunning view in Halong Bay. Trekking on terrace rice fields with breathtaking landscape in Sapa. Experiencing the local Hmong people in mounatainous Sapa. Still have more and more waiting for you exploring. Let’s enjoy!

timeline.title: Day 1: Hanoi city arrival – Hotel check in (Meal: No)
timeline.description:
In and around HanoiWelcome to Hanoi city. Driver is waiting for you at the airport to transfer you to the hotel in the center. Check in the hotel and free time to take your first step exploring the city. Overnight at the hotel in Hanoi. Please Note: Hotel check-in time: 13:00 Start point
 Noi Bai International Airport, Noi Bai International Airport, Sóc Sơn, Huyện Sóc Sơn, Hanoi 140800, Vietnam

timeline.title: Day 2: Ninh Binh – Hoa Lu ancient capital – Tam Coc Rowing boat – Cycling 1 Day (Meal: B,L)
timeline.description: 8:00 – 8:30: Driver and tour guide will meet you at your hotel and depart the Hoa Lu – Tam Coc tour. Bus will stop on the half way to get the break time after 1 hour and half in the bus. At this moment, you can stretch your legs and take some photos of countryside. Keep heading to Hoa Lu – the ancient capital of Vietnam in 10th century under 2 Dynasties: Dinh and Le Empire. You will understand much more about Vietnam with King Dinh and King Le’s temple. Through this trip, you have the chance to find out about the history, culture, architecture, and development of Vietnam what is still maybe strange of you. Then, bus will transfer you to the local restaurant where you have the buffet Lunch with a lot of local food. And one of most special and famous in Ninh Binh is goat meat. After Lunch time, tour guide will help you understanding about Tam Coc before enjoy the rowing boat time on Ngo Dong river. Ngo Dong river meanders among the mountains and you will have the feeling that we are living in the most peaceful and beautiful place in the world. Boat takes you through the 3 caves ( Hang Ca, Hang Hai, Hang Ba ). You see not only the “ Halong Bay on land”, but also you have the chance to meet the local farmers who is working in the rice field. Lovely time to understand more the local countryside’s life in Vietnam. After rowing boat time in Tam Coc, you are riding bicycle to the paddy field and through the local villages to discover the simple daily life of local people, you will have the awesome experience in the country. 16:00: Get back the bus and heading back to Hanoi. Saying goodbye the lovely point. 18:30: Arrive the hotel in Hanoi old quarter.  Overnight at hotel in Hanoi

timeline.title: Day 3: Hanoi Street Food Walking Tour (Meal: B,D)
timeline.description: Today, you have free time to visit Hanoi city until 6:00 PM, Your tour guide picks you up from hotel to our meeting point. Star the journey discovering the local foods in Hanoi like street Foodie. Walking through some old streets there, you will discover historical and culture tourist site, visit Heritage House to learn more about Traditional House of Ancient Hanoi. You have chance to enjoy “Bánh Cuốn” from famous local restaurant,  “Bánh Cuốn” (steamed rice rolls) which  is steamed and made from rice flour and filled with a savory ground pork and  ear mushroom mixture. Then stop off at traditional space to try “Che” (sweet gruel)- a very special and famous sweet soup Hanoi old quarter. Then, keep walking to enjoy a bowl of  Pho- taste of  heaven that you could not be anywhere better than Hanoi. Spring roll is very meaningful dish for tourist; many restaurant and company organize cooking class. You will visit Local market to see people show all products, it is really interesting to learn about lifestyle and culture of local people. You will enjoy Bun Cha (Vermicelli with grill pork), an absolute highlight of authentic local culinary you must try as anyone’s the first visit of Hanoi. Then you will savor the real taste of Hanoian at a small corner of Hanoi by drinking a cup of “Bia Hoi”(Fresh beer).  Finally, get the chance to enjoy a very special flavor of the Vietnamese-“Cafe Trung”( egg coffee). 9:00 pm: Turn back to the hotel.  Overnight at hotel in Hanoi.

timeline.title: Day 4: Hanoi – Halong Bay – Overnight on cruise (Meal:B,L,D)
timeline.description: 8:00 – 8:30 am: Meeting your tour guide at the hotel and depart for Halong bay trip. Short break-time on the haft way for relax before reaching Halong Bay.  Vietnamese Lunch will be served after check in the cabin on cruise and cruising through the bay to the center. Exploring the beauty of Surprising cave – the most beautiful and biggest one in the bay. Leisurely time hiking and swimming on the beach of Titop island. Get back the boat for Sunset Party with fresh fruit & local glass wine. Dinner with delicious local dishes and free evening to feeling Halong Bay. Overnight on the cruise

timeline.title: Day 5: Halong Bay – Hanoi (Meal:B,L)
timeline.description: You should wake up little early to enjoy the Sunrise in Halong Bay. After breakfast, doing Kayaking by your own to discovering Halong Bay.  Learning how to make Vietnamese Spring-roll in Cooking Demonstration on the cruise. Lunch time while cruising back the harbor. Get on the bus back to Hanoi. 17:00: Arrive the hotel in Hanoi. Overnight at hotel in Hanoi city

timeline.title: Day 6: Hanoi city Past & Present by your own – Water Puppet Show (Meal:B)
timeline.description: Today, you have the free time to visit Hanoi old quarte by your own. Exploring the local life and culture, custom. Tasting several local foods. 17:00: Guide will take you to the Water Puppet Theatre for show and come back the hotel by your own. Overnight at hotel in Hanoi.

timeline.title: Day 7: Hanoi – Sapa – Ylinh Ho – Lao Chai – Ta Van village ( Meals: B, L, D )
timeline.description: 12km trekking through the terrace fields to homestay. 06:30 – 07:00: Shuttle bus and tour guide will pick you up at your hotel and transfer you to sleeper bus. Heading to Sapa with short break-time on the half way. 12:30 pm: Our guide would love to welcome you to Sapa. Pick you up when you arrive Sapa and start enjoy Real Sapa Experience trip. From Sapa town, you have the chance trekking through the town to see the background of the daily life and architecture. Chill out the town, you will step on the terrace rice, corn and potato fields. Not only trekking to see the natural landscape, fresh air, but also host will love to share with you about their local culture, custom and habit. You will get the feeling that you are a member of her family, non-touristy. Trekking through the villages to see and understand much more the life of minority in Sapa. With the simple house, life and people, you get the light feeling and want to stay there for longer time. On trekking route, terrace by terrace fields will appear in front of you, with the lovely waterfall where you will have a nice time for relaxing, taking photo. Arrive guide’s house, her family will welcome you as a member back home for long time no see. You will prepare the dinner with her family if you like it. Pick the vegetable from the garden, cooking the local foods in the kitchen while sharing a lot of stories with each other. Evening time, it is the nicest time to experience the local family’s atmosphere. Sharing and learning their culture with the stories host is so happy to share with you. Overnight at guide’s house.

timeline.title: Day 8: Ta Van – Giang Ta Chai village – Sapa – Hanoi ( Meals: B, L )
timeline.description: You can wake up a little early to see how about host starting a new day. Cooking breakfast and join altogether. You have the options: + Trekking to see the further village and sceneries, through the Bamboo forest, terrace fields. +Or, you can tell your guide to go to their family’s fields to work, such as harvesting, or planting, or taking care their fields. Get back to Sapa town by shuttle bus. You still have the free time to visit local market in Sapa town, and discover Sapa town by your own before come back to Hanoi. 15:30: Get on the sleeper bus and come back Hanoi city. 21:30: Arrive Hanoi. Shuttle bus will transfer you back to your hotel/stay in Hanoi Old Quarter. Overnight at hotel in Hanoi

timeline.title: Day 9: Hanoi Departure (Meal: B)
timeline.description:
Today, you have free time to relax, shopping the souvenir for your family, until driver transfers you to Hanoi airport for your flight out. Trip ends. Please let us know if you want to extend your trip Please note: If you are Solo traveller booking for Share room, you will stay at Share Dorm Room during the vacation.End point
 Noi Bai International Airport, Noi Bai International Airport, Sóc Sơn, Huyện Sóc Sơn, Hanoi 140800, Vietnam

name: Challenging Vietnam Motorcycle Tour to Ha Giang, Cao Bang via Sapa, Bac Ha, Yen Bai
summary: In this motorbike tour, we not only travel to the impressive destinations in Ha Giang Province, but also explore the amazing natural beauties in mountainous northern Vietnam with a ride from Hanoi to Vu Linh Village in Yen Bai to glance at the beauty of Thac Ba lake then Luc Yen and Lao Cai. From here, we’ll keep on our motorbike tour rolling to Bac Ha market then Ha Giang with Dong Van, Meo Vac, Bao Lac and Ba Be lake in Cao Bang before riding back to Hanoi.

timeline.title: Day 1: HANOI MOTORCYCLE TOURS TO VU LINH VILLAGE ( THAC BA LAKE, YEN BAI)
timeline.description: In and around HanoiWe start our Motorbike tour by riding on to dyke roads following Red river to Thac Ba lake. See beautiful countryside, rice and green tea fields. Then we turn to the little road to Vu Linh village, where populated by Dzao ethnic minority by the side of Thac Ba lake, very friendly people and the welcome is exceptional. Home-stay in Vu Linh  Summary: Distance:  180 km Meals: Lunch, Dinner Accommodation: Home-stay

timeline.title: Day 2: THAC BA MOTORCYCLE TOURS TO LUC YEN (YEN BAI)
timeline.description: After breakfast, we take the boat ride on Thac Ba lake, the biggest man-made lake in Vietnam. Stop by an island for swimming and discover the particularities of this area: the way villagers paddle their boats, the exotic and odd animals living around, the quiet and peaceful beauty of this huge lake, the lifestyle of the Dao among the thousands of islets. Back to home-stay for lunch. Get on the road, take a half-day ride through palm forest all the way to Luc Yen and stay in a family in the Tay territory. It’s a great home stay and the hosts are very welcoming. Home-stay in Luc Yen Summary: Distance:  100 km Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner Accommodation: Home-stay

timeline.title: Day 3: LUC YEN MOTORCYCLE TOURS TO BAC HA (LAO CAI)
timeline.description: Motorcycle to get out to Road 70 up north to Khanh Hoa T-junction, turn to Road 153 to Bac Ha.This small highland town fills up to choking point on Sunday morning, when visitors flood in to meet the Flower H’mong at the morning market. Compared with Sapa, tourism is still in its infancy here and during the week the town has a deserted feel. Bac Ha is a good base to explore the surrounding highlands. Around 900m above sea level, it is noticeably warmer than Sapa. One of Bac Ha’s main industries is she manufacture of alcoholic home brews (rice wine, cassava wine and corn liquor). The corn hooch produced by the Flower H’mong is so potent it can ignite! Bac Ha is the only place in Vietnam where you’ll find this particular moonshine; there’s an entire area devoted to it at the Sunday market. Overnight in Bac Ha. Summary: Distance:  140 km Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner Accommodation: Home-stay

timeline.title: Day 4: BAC HA MOTORCYCLE TOURS TO HA GIANG CITY
timeline.description: After breakfast, beautiful motor ride on the track to Xin Man and Hoang Su Phi on many small; back roads with scenic mountain views. Xin Man is right on the border between Vietnam and China. It is, as of this writing, well hidden and completely surrounded by wild mountains and forests. There’s a single road from Xin Man to Hoang Su Phi. Hoang Su Phi is among the most untouched area of Ha Giang Province of Vietnam. The area was separated from the mainstream society until very recently. Passing Hoang Su Phi, we will be charmed by the pristine beauty of the wild mountains and the authentic culture of the local ethnic groups which include: the Nung, the Flower H’mong, the Tay and the Ha Nhi People… After lunch, join the main road heading up to Ha Giang City, where we stop for the night and apply for a permit. Summary: Distance:  200 km Meals: Breakfast, Lunch  Accommodation: Hotel

timeline.title: Day 5: HA GIANG MOTORCYCLE TOURS TO DONG VAN
timeline.description: After getting the permit for motorbike tour in border areas at Ha Giang’s Immigration Police, we ride on small challenging mountain roads (but incredibly beautiful) on the land of colorful mountain hill-tribes. Head up the Ma Pi Leng Pass. Here is yet another amazing place, with cloudy mountain ranges and the poetic Nho Que river winding off in the distance. It is really difficult to find the exact words to describe Ma Pi Leng Pass, located between Dong Van and Meo Vac, near the northernmost tip of Vietnam, as a painting of astonishing beauty and magnificence that captures the eyes of all viewers and nature lovers. Ride on a zig-zag track until reaching Vuong Family’s Residence, 14 kms before Dong Van. Vuong Family was considered the King of the Hmong People in Dong Van, Ha Giang. Their residence was built in the scenic valley of Sa Phin with Chinese architecture. The whole house was built out of wood and rock only. The rocks for the buildings were imported from China. Vuong Family Residence is a masterpiece of man work in the valley of heavenly beauty of Sa Phin. This is a remote area and we can meet the hard-working local people here. It is inspiring to see how they survive as they manage live in the rocks. When we reach Dong Van Town we will have some extra time to wonder the ancient streets lined with H’mong homes of clay bricks and tiles roofs built centuries ago. Summary: Distance:  160 km Meals: Breakfast, Lunch Accommodation: Hotel

timeline.title: Day 6: DONG VAN MOTORCYCLE TOURS PASSING MEO VAC TO BAO LAC (CAO BANG)
timeline.description: The road is still under construction and tracks what make the ride relatively long in spite of few kilometres. The landscape is among the most beautiful of Vietnam, and the slow tempo is only more appreciable. We motorcycle across the wild regions of the mythical province of Ha Giang, Meo Vac is included. It shares the border with Dong Van District of Ha Giang Province and Bao Lam District of Cao Bang Province. Meo Vac has most of the terrain in the Rock Plateau of Dong Van and above 1000m above sea level. Meo Vac has a harsh climate in the winter which is from November to April with dry and freezing cold weather. It is inhabited by different ethnic minorities including the H’mong, the King, Tay, Dzao…Most ethnic groups have maintained their culture untouched from the outside world. In the afternoon, we stop for the night at Bao Lac, the ethnic crossroad of Northeast Vietnam. Many other ethnic groups on the two sides of the border meet at the market every Sunday. Summary: Distance:  80 km Meals: Breakfast, Lunch Accommodation: Hotel

timeline.title: Day 7: BAO LAC MOTORCYCLE TOURS TO BA BE NATIONAL PARK (BAC KAN)
timeline.description: Beautiful motor ride down to Bac Kan Province. Few passes from where you can dominate the area. The road is easy but there are many blind curves before we turn to Ba Be lake (inside Ba Be National Park). Ba Be National Park is an abundant bioreserve area containing the world’s only fresh-water karst lake and several rare species of fauna and flora. Ba Be lake in VietnamThe biodiverse 10,048ha park – home to 1,268 species of flora and fauna, a series of caves and a gigantic fresh water lake – was established in 1992 by the Vietnamese Government to preserve forest ecosystems in the northeast. Ba Be is home to over 3,000 people from the ethnic minorities of Tay, Nung, Dao and Mong, who live in 13 villages within the park. The Tay people have inhabited Ba Be area for centuries and make up 58 per cent of the population within the park’s boundaries. Motorcycle into Bac Ngoi village, which is located inside Ba Be National Park. Our home-stay in Tay’s family is right by the side of Ba Be lake with wonderful and peaceful view. Summary: Distance:  140 km Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner Accommodation: Home-stay

timeline.title: Day 8: BA BE MOTORCYCLE TOURS TO NA HANG (BAC KAN)
timeline.description: Half-day boat-ride on the lake to the other side, where we can explore Dau Dang waterfall on Nang river. As one of the 27 ASEAN heritage gardens, Ba Be has the potential to attract naturelovers with its 450ha natural fresh water lake, and 553 species of mammals, birds, reptiles, amphibians and fish. According to a survey from the Viet Nam Institute of Geo-sciences and Mineral Resources, over 11,000 years ago, an earthquake caused a collapse of the subterranean Nang River, creating a natural dam which led to the formation of Ba Be Lake. Lunch in a village near by Dau Dang waterfall before back to home-stay. Get on our bikes and take a half-day ride on countryside to Na Hang. This Nung’s village is in middle of nowhere. We have last experience on the trip to share the meals and house with locals. Summary: Distance:  80 km Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner Accommodation: Home-stay / Hotel

timeline.title: Day 9: NA HANG MOTORCYCLE TOURS BACK TO HANOI
timeline.description: Easy motor ride in the morning, passing peaceful villages and rice fields before reaching very busy road in the afternoon. Traffic is getting worst and worst on Road 3, the way back to Hanoi, so we should be back before rush hour. Finish our trip around 4 pm  Summary: Distance:  160 km Meals: Breakfast, Lunch

name: Spectacular Northern Motorbike Tour to Ha Giang via Ba Be, Cao Bang, Dong Van
summary: This our 5-day Vietnam Northern Motorbike Tour to Ha Giang brings tourist a full view of Ha Giang and other northern destinations of Vietnam such as Ba Be Lake in Bac Kan Province, Bao Lac in Cao Bang and Dong Van Geo-park in Ha Giang and then to Lao Cai / Sapa for a night train back to Hanoi!

timeline.title: Day 1: Hanoi Motorbike Tours to Ba Be lake – 240 km
timeline.description: In and around HanoiThis Vietnam motorcycle tour to Ha Giang starts at around 8 AM from eastern suburbs of Hanoi. We try the best to avoid busy city road in the morning until Cho Chu town( in Thai Nguyen province) where we have lunch. After lunch, we surely have enjoyable motorbike ride to Ba Be lake because the roads have less traffic and offer you a lot of grand mountain view. At about 4 PM, we arrive Pac Ngoi – a beautiful village of Tay people which located peacefully at Ba Be lake’s side. Diner and stay with the Tay’s family. Overnight in Ba Be lake – home stay. Ba Bể Lake (Vietnamese: Hồ Ba Bể; Ba means Three, Bể is from the Tay language word pé, meaning “lake”) is the largest natural lake in Vietnam. It is located in Nam Mẫu commune, Bắc Kạn district, Bắc Kạn Province in the northeastern region of the country.Having been formed approximately 200 million years ago, the lake is surrounded by limestone cliffs, which in turn are covered by primary forests. The lake comprises three zones named Pé Lầm, Pé Lù, and Pé Lèng. Three rivers, named Năng, Tả Han, and Nam Cường, are the main inflows of the lake. The Năng river enters the lake through a large waterfall called Đầu Đẳng. In the lake there are also three islands, named Án Mã, Khẩu Cúm, and Po Gia Mải (literally “Widow’s Island”).Ba Bể Lake is a featured geographical science and is a biodiversity reservoir. It is a part of the Ba Be National Park.  * Summary: + Distance: roughly 240km + Riding duration: nearly 8 hours + Meals: Lunch + Dinner + Accommodation: Homestay in the village

timeline.title: Day 2: BABE LAKE MOTORBIKE TOURS TO BAO LAC – 150 KM
timeline.description: After the early breakfast with the family, Take a short walk about 1km to the pier and then enjoy one and a half hour boat cruise around the largest natural lake in Vietnam – Ba Be. Lunch with the Tay family, In the after noon we will have  off-road motorbike tour in Vietnam. We will ride the bikes through a small part of Ba Be National Park,many beautiful villages and some streams, the tour will give you a lot of challenge and amazing beauty of mountain area in northern Vietnam. Arrive Bao Lac at 5 PM. Stay in town – Hotel.  * Summary: + Distance: roughly 150km + Riding duration: nearly 5 hours + Meals: Breakfast & Lunch + Accommodation: Hotel

timeline.title: Day 3: BAO LAC MOTORBIKE TOURS TO THE DONG VAN GLOBAL GEO-PARK IN HA GIANG. – 140 KM
timeline.description: Today, we will have relaxing, easy and very enjoyable motorbike tour to Dong Van. Start the day at about 9 Am, ride slowly along the Gam river to enjoy the green mountains and mountains. We will be in Meo Vac for lunch. After lunch, it could be the best motorbike tour in Vietnam to ride cross Ma-Pi-Leng pass ( It’s one of the longest and most beautiful passes in North Vietnam. We can have hundreds of stops for picture of The Dong Van Rock Plateau Global Geo-park, and the local ethnic minorities. Stay overnight in Dong Van town – Hotel.  * Summary: + Distance: roughly 140km + Riding duration: nearly 5 hours + Meals: Breakfast & Lunch + Accommodation: Hotel

timeline.title: Day 4: DONG VAN MOTORBIKE TOURS TO HA GIANG. – 150 KM
timeline.description: This motorbike tour to Ha Giang goes through the poorest part of Vietnam but the scenery is most imposing where you will be surpri se to see many ethnic groups with their unique cultures and amazing mountain view of the Rock Plateau, the Vuong palace in Dong Van, The “Heaven Gate” in Quan Ba. This is surely the best Vietnam motorbike tour in the northern part with many interesting and amazing things in every meter of the road. Arrive Ha Giang in the late afternoon. Dinner and stay with the other Tay’s family.   * Summary: + Distance: roughly 150km + Riding duration: nearly 5 hours + Meals: Breakfast & Lunch + Accommodation: Hotel

timeline.title: Day 5: HA GIANG VIETNAM MOTORBIKE TOUR TO LAO CAI – NIGHT TRAIN BACK TO HANOI – 180 KM
timeline.description: After breakfast with family, we have smooth motorbike ride on road No 2 for a bout 40 km, and then we will take a turn to a small road to Pho Rang – the road is small and somewhere bumpy but scenery is completely different from what you saw in days before. The scenery is the wonderful mixture of green mountain, rice fields and graceful villages of the ethnic people. Lunch is in Pho Rang and after lunch we have easy Vietnam motorbike tour to Lao Cai on the winding road with the different view from what we’ve seen. Before getting into town center we will have short visit to China and Vietnam border, then motorcycle straight to the Lao Cai Railway Station and put all the bikes on the train. Finish the Vietnam motorbike tour to Ha Giang and take a night train back to Hanoi after dinner in Lao Cai.  * Summary: + Distance: roughly 150km + Riding duration: nearly 5 hours + Meals: Breakfast & Lunch + Accommodation: On train

name: Scenic Saigon Motorcycle Tour to Nha Trang via Mui Ne and Da Lat, Bao Loc
summary: This Vietnam Motorbike Tour from Saigon to Nha Trang via Mui Ne, Da Lat within 5 days / 4 nights bring riders to explore all stunning beauties of Southern Vietnam. You will have a chance to visit almost the remote areas of central highlands Vietnam, also some famous attraction from Saigon up to Nha Trang. Especially, it is also the recommended motorcycle tour on the coastline of Vietnam.

timeline.title: Day 1: SAI GON MOTORBIKE TOUR TO LA GI: 150 KM (L,D – HOTEL STAY)
timeline.description:
In and around Ho Chi Minh CityWe start the Saigon motorbike tour at 8:30. From the city center of HCMC, we hit the city roads to the northeast of Saigon to La Gi town. We will have some interesting visits of Minh Dam Army base, Thuong Chieu Monastery pagoda and Binh Chau hot water spring. After lunch, we will have great short motorbike ride on the coastal roads to La Gi. We’ll be at La Gi at about 4:30 pm.Start point
 Your Hotel, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam 08:00

timeline.title: Day 2: LA GI MOTORCYCLE TOURS TO MUI NE: 130 KM (B,L,D – HOTEL STAY)
timeline.description: It’s short day ride but it’s surely the highlight of this short Saigon motorbike tour. We will have one of the best coastlines motorbike tours in Vietnam today. After breakfast, motorcycling up to the north along the coast to Mui Ne, we’ll pay more visits to Temples, colorful markets of local people and some interesting old towers of the Cham. We will be in Mui Ne at around 4:00 pm. Spend the rest time of the day at one of the most beautiful beaches in the world – Mui Ne.

timeline.title: Day 3: MUI NE MOTORBIKE RIDE TO BAO LOC: 160 KM (B,L,D – HOTEL STAY)
timeline.description: After early breakfast in the hotel, we leave the town to visit the fairy springs, red canyons white sand dunes and some rustic villages who do fishing everyday to earn living or growing dragon fruits besides coffee plantation…. Then we continue motorcycle tour to the Central Highlands, along the way we will do more stops to visit the K’ho ethnic minority villages to learn about the culture of their wild life in the edge of the Central Highlands. We would arrive in Bao Loc after visiting Dambri waterfall (90 meters high). Overnight in Bao Loc.

timeline.title: Day 4: BAO LOC MOTORCYCLE TOUR TO DA LAT: 140 KM (B,L,D – HOTEL STAY)
timeline.description: Start the motorbike tour to Da lat at about 8:30 am. It’s a short motorbike ride up to Da Lat but it offers a beautiful view of mountain and green plantation. We will see plenty of green tea farm, mushroom fields, vegetable and flower farm, coffee plantations and visit some villages who produce silk and learn how to make a good silk from silkworm. This must be another highlight of the motorbike tour central highlands Vietnam. We will be in Da Lat at 4:00 pm.

timeline.title: Day 5: DA LAT MOTORBIKE TRIP TO NHA TRANG: 150 KM (B, L)
timeline.description: In and around Nha TrangThe last day of the Saigon motorbike tour start at 8:30 am, most of the ride is on sealed, smooth roads except some small “monkey bridges” just after Da Lat town however it offers one of the best coastline motorbike ride in Vietnam. We still do some stops to visit King Bao Dai’s palace or peaceful villages of the hill tribe along the way. The 5 day enjoyable Vietnam motorbike tour will finish at around 4.30 PM in the coastal city of Nha Trang. Check in the hotel of your choice and then enjoy your relaxing time on the beach.

name: Best Selling Saigon Motorbike Tour to Mekong Delta, Dalat, Nha Trang, Mui Ne and Vung Tau
summary: This Saigon Motorbike Tour to Dalat, Nha Trang, Mui Ne, and Vung Tau is the perfect way to discover not only evergreen Mekong Delta and romantic highlands city of Dalat but also the Southern part boasting the stunning sunny beaches in Nha Trang, Mui Ne and Vung Tau where you have chance to sit back and relax.

timeline.title: Day 1: ARRIVAL – HO CHI MINH CITY (-/-/-)
timeline.description:
In and around Ho Chi Minh CityUpon landing at the airport at around 15:05, you’ll be welcome then escorted to your hotel for a check-in. The rest of time, you’ll be free to explore Saigon by night. Overnight at hotel.Start point
 Your Hotel, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam 08:00

timeline.title: Day 2: HO CHI MINH CITY MOTORBIKE TOUR TO MEKONG DELTA (B/L/-)
timeline.description: In the morning, our motorbike tour will be started from your hotel in Ho Chi Minh City Saigon Motorcycle tours and depart to Can Duoc Market – a stunning rural market (40 km). The scene changes from bustling streets with buildings and noise to peaceful rice paddles with cottages and small houses on the way – in the open air of “steel horses”.  Then take a rural route to My Loi Ferry. Some stops en route to see farmers working on paddy fields. Cross Vam Co river by the ferry then ride to Go Cong then Tan Hoa (25km). Have some stops en-route to visit an incense workshop, through some remote villages and reach Tan Thanh beach for seafood lunch. Then continue riding from this Mekong Delta beach to My Tho(45km), the heart of the Mekong Delta.  Arrive My Tho, stop by the bank of Tien Giang River. Take a boat trip on Mekong River to Phoenix Island where local handicrafts and sweets from coconut are being produced. Enjoy fresh seasonal fruits and traditional live music and songs performance. Take a short ride to a typical local house to taste some homemade honey-tea.  Proceed by small sampan boats through the small canals and side arms of the river to observe the Tiengiang motorbike tours daily life along the river banks with a stop and short leisurely walk at the Turtle Island. Ride through Rach Mieu suspension-bridge for a breath-taking view of the Upper Mekong and transfer to Ho Chi Minh city (70 km). The trip ends at your hotel.  Summary: Distance: 190 km Meals: Lunch

timeline.title: Day 3: HO CHI MINH MOTORCYCLE TOUR TO BAO LOC – LAM DONG (B/L/D)
timeline.description: Leave all chaos of Saigon behind, we’ll keep rolling the wheels to the Central Highlands and stop in the K’ho ethnic minority village to learn the culture of their wildlife at the edge of the Central Highlands. Arrive in Bao Loc after visiting Dambri waterfall – about 90 meters high then Tam Chau tea plateau & Linh Quy Phan An pagoda. Overnight in Bao Loc.  Bảo Lộc is a city of Lâm Đồng Province in the Central Highlands region of Vietnam. Bảo Lộc is famous for its registered trademark: B’lao tea. As of 2003, the town district had a population of 151,915. The district covers an area of 229 km2.  Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner Overnight at hotel in Bao Loc

timeline.title: Day 4: BAO LOC MOTORBIKE TOUR DALAT ( 140 KM – 5 HOUR RIDE) (B/L/D)
timeline.description: In and around DalatLeaving Bao Loc for Dalat, visit the green tea farms, the cascade waterfall, Pongour, mushroom farms, silkworm villages, and silk processing chains, coffee plantations, mushrooms, vegetable, and flower farms, visit the highlights of the city like Crazy House, Flower Market, Dragon Pagoda. Arrive in Dalat around 5 pm.  Đà Lạt, the capital of Lâm Đồng Province in southern Vietnam’s Central Highlands, is centered around a lake and golf course and surrounded by hills, pine forests, lakes, and waterfalls. Known as the “City of Eternal Spring” for its distinctive temperate climate, Đà Lạt was developed as a resort by the French in the early 1900s, and many reminders of its colonial heritage remain.  Meals: Lunch, Dinner.

timeline.title: Day 5: DA LAT OFFROAD MOTORBIKE TOUR TO BUON MA THUOT VIA LAK LAKE ~ 200 KM (B/L/D)
timeline.description: After having breakfast at hotel, we’ll jump on our iron horses then keep riding to Buon Ma Thuot via Lak Lake. On the way, you can take a quick visit at the crazy house, travel along the country road to see the entire agriculture farm such as vegetable farm, greenhouse flower farm, coffee plantation, a visit of silkworm factory, rice wine making and elephant waterfall.  Arrive at Lak Lake with a visit to the “Jun” Minority Village (M’Nong). Crossing the Lak Lake by boat to Lieng minority village, with many opportunities of taking pictures of people farming and fishing Overnight at hotel in Buon Ma Thuot.

timeline.title: Day 6: BUON MA THUOT OFFROAD MOTORCYCLE TOUR TO NHA TRANG ~ 210 KM (B/L/-)
timeline.description: In and around Nha TrangToday, we say goodbye to the land of Coffee – Buon Ma Thuot to ride straight to Nha Trang. On the way, you have half an hour trekking to the top of the Elephant rock mountain, back on the road again, on the back of the motorbikes you will have opportunities to observe the panorama view of rice paddy field along the road, and then, a quick visit to the Ede Minority Village.  One more waterfall name: Dray Nao waterfall between Lak Lake and Nha Trang, Descend along the Phoenix Pass (affect by Agent Orange) and a visit the Hot spring, the brick-making factory, 20 km ride along the beach will lead you to the most Charming beach in Vietnam: Nha Trang beach then check in at hotel. Overnight at hotel in Nha Trang.

timeline.title: Day 7: NHA TRANG SIGHTSEEING TOUR (B/L/-)
timeline.description: 08h30: Pick up at hotel & transfer to Cau Da harbor. 09h00: Take a boat trip to visit Bays in Nha Trang, which includes 19 big & small islands with imposing beauty. 10h00: Visit Hon Mun’s Preservation Area of Oceanic creatures. On this island, you will be steeped in the transparent cool water & diving to explore the coral reefs having been formed for 200 years with many kinds of precious fishes. 12h00: Come to Hon Mot Island for lunch on the boat. After having lunch, you may engage in a dancing & singing performance with many other visitors all over the world meanwhile enjoy free fruits & grape wine. 13h30: Arrive at Hon Tam Island, visit the statue of My Nhan Ngu & participate in sporting events in the water like Jeski, Gliding, volleyball….(Pay for yourself) 15h00: Visit fishing Village to learn more about their daily local life & get on the small bamboo boat to floating rafts. 16h00: Get back to Cau Da pier & transfer to hotel. Overnight at hotel in Nha Trang.

timeline.title: Day 8: NHA TRANG MOTORBIKING TRIPS TO MUI NE CAPE (B/L/-)
timeline.description: After having breakfast at hotel.  8h00: Our motorbike tour will start leaving to Mui Ne, on the way we will stop by Ca Na and some other beautiful beaches to take a break as well as photos or if needed, you can jump on the sea to soak up yourself. Upon arrival in Mui Ne, we’ll check-in at hotel then ride to a local restaurant for lunch. This afternoon, we will ride our bikes to visit Fishing villages, Hong Stream, Golden Sand Dunes and Flying Sand Dunes, right here you can engage some optional outdoor games to make funs by yourself such as skating on sand or flying a kite…  Last stop is at Bau Sen – a vast sand dune which has inspired numerous photographers for many years The rest of time, you could take a bath on Mui Ne beach and view sunset.  Overnight at hotel in Mui Ne

timeline.title: Day 9: MUI NE MOTORBIKE TOUR TO VUNG TAU VIA PHAN THIET (B/L/-)
timeline.description: Breakfast at your hotel & check out. Back on our “steel horses” and we will keep riding along the coastal paved road, passing quiet pine forest of Loc An and we arrive Binh Chau hot spring, take a mud bath and relax on Hot Spring Lake. Having lunch at a local restaurant en-route.  In the afternoon, we’ll keep on riding to Phuoc Hai hamlet, we will be impressed by the beautiful scenery, especially the sections of road straddled by mountains and beaches then Minh Dam historical mountain and Long Phuoc Tunnels before reaching Vung Tau. Upon arrival, you’ll check in at hotel and relax by yourself.  Overnight at hotel in Vung Tau.

timeline.title: Day 10: VUNG TAU MOTORBIKING TOURS BACK TO SAIGON – DEPARTURE (B/L/-)
timeline.description: Breakfast at your hotel & then you’ll be at leisure on the beach or hanging around Vung Tau city till the time to ride back to the Tan Son Nhat airport in Saigon for a flight home.

name: Wandering Northern Vietnam Motorbike Tour to Ta Xua , Mu Cang Chai, Y Ty, Sapa
summary: This 7-day Northern Vietnam Motorbike Tour to Ta Xua, Mu Cang Chai, Y Ty, Sapa, Bat Xat, Mai Chau, Bac Yen in Son La takes you to explore the best authentic northwest of Vietnam with rice terraces, dirt rides through jungles, high mountains & remote villages cum waterfalls and rivers … to meet the friendly locals and taste their great local foods …

timeline.title: Day 1: HANOI MOTORBIKE TOUR TO MAI CHAU VALLEY (HOA BINH)
timeline.description: In and around HanoiStart our motorbike tour by leaving Hanoi on dyke roads to avoid the heavy traffic around 9.am, we ride our motorcycles west to Mai Chau, an area of beautiful landscape and home to the Thai ethnic minority. We will motorcycle on Highway 6 passing extensive farming lands comprising a sea of paddy fields split by tree-lined roads punctuated by limestone karst scenery.  After a light lunch in Hoa Binh Province, we cross Thung Khe, one of the most beautiful mountain passes in North Vietnam then descent to the mountain valley settlement of Mai Chau. After dinner we join performance, where you can dance and share a range of special liquors (rice wine) with the locals. Overnight in a house-on-stilts of the Thai people. Summary :

timeline.title: Day 2: MAI CHAU MOTORCYCLE TOUR TO BAC YEN (SON LA)
timeline.description: In the morning, we take a short walk around village to discover local life. Life in the countryside starts early so by sunrise there is a wealth of activity. The Thai women are masterful weavers who ensure that there is plenty of traditional-style clothing to buy in the village centre.  You will see women weaving on looms under or inside their houses in the village We can buy some handmade traditional-style clothing, knife or cross-bow. After breakfast in home-stay, we say goodbye to villagers and leave Mai Chau around 10 am. We ride from Mai Chau to the direction of Moc Chau, where we have lunch.
